title: UX-designer
description:
På Migrationsverket arbetar vi med en av vår tids stora samhällsfrågor – migrationen. Totalt är vi cirka 6 000 personer här, och vi har ett ovanligt viktigt jobb!


Vi söker dig som vill jobba tillsammans med trevliga och kompetenta medarbetare i en trygg anställning, är grym på att förstå användarupplevelsen - och skapar prototyper som får nejsägare att bli hej! sägare. En kreativ **UX/UI designer** helt enkelt!


På Migrationsverket bygger vi system som faktiskt används, varje dag, av många. Nu letar vi efter en UX-designer som vill vara med och utveckla samhällsviktig IT – i modern teknik & design, tillsammans med smarta kollegor och med mandat att påverka på riktigt. Det här är inte en startup (men vi har pingisbord). Det här är något bättre: stabilitet, mening och designutmaningar i samma paket.


Läs mer om att arbeta med IT hos oss: Jobba med IT – Migrationsverket

 **Vad du faktiskt kommer att göra**


Välkommen till system -och plattformsutvecklingsenhet 3. Här jobbar juniora och seniora utvecklare sida vid sida med kravanalytiker och UX designer; med produkter för dokumentskapande, diarieföring, informationsstyrning och e-arkivering samt nya området masterdata-person.


Som UX designer får du en viktig roll – du bestämmer HUR grejerna ska funka bra för användarna.


Exempel på saker du kommer göra

* Jobba med uppdragsgivare, användare och kravanalytiker - analysera krav och behov
* Designa målgruppsanpassade lösningar - presentera och testa lösningar


Vara centralt UX-stöd för teamens utvecklare och leverera design för implementation

**Vi behöver att du har**

* Högskoleutbildning inom UX/UI design - eller motsvarande yrkesutbildning (KY)
* God kommunikativ förmåga i tal och skrift.
* Svenskt medborgarskap (krav vid placering i säkerhetsklass).

**Extra plus om du har**

* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom UX
* Erfarenhet av agila & iterativa metoder
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med designsystem som t.ex. MUI
* Expertkunskaper i Figma eller liknande designverktyg
* Erfarenhet av att hålla i workshops och liknande

**Vem tror vi att du är?**


Nyfiken, analytisk, kreativ och orädd. Du gillar att samarbeta, delar gärna med dig av din kunskap, och är inte rädd för att säga “det här kan vi göra bättre”. Gärna att du har jobbat några år med UX/UI design, men du kan också vara helt i början av din karriär.

**Om anställningen (det formella, men viktiga)**

*Tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning – vilket innebär* ***krav på svenskt medborgarskap.***


Anställningsform: Tillsvidare


Arbetstider: Kontorstid (flextid)


Lön: Individuell lönesättning


Placering: Norrköping eller Linköping


Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse

**Vill du veta mer?**


Kontaktuppgifter till ansvarig enhetschef hittar du längre ner i annonsen.


Läs mer om våra förmåner och villkor: Förmåner och villkor – Migrationsverket

**Ansökan**


Välkommen med din ansökan senast den **18:e januari 2026!**


Vi tar emot din ansökan via vårt rekryteringssystem.

  

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Om rekryteringsprocessen För oss är det viktigt att all kompetens på arbetsmarknaden tillvaratas. Vi välkomnar därför alla sökande och strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och mångfald. Som statlig myndighet rekryterar vi efter förtjänst och skicklighet. På arbetsgivarverket.se kan du läsa mer om vad det innebär. Vi använder urvalsfrågor under ansökningen. Besvara dem så utförligt du kan eftersom dina svar har betydelse för om du är kvalificerad att gå vidare i rekryteringen eller inte. I vissa rekryteringar använder vi också tester för att bedöma hur väl din skicklighet stämmer överens med tjänsten du söker. Vid en eventuell intervju kan du även få svara på frågor kopplat till säkerhet. Vill du komma i kontakt med fackliga företrädare finns kontaktuppgifter till Saco-S, Seko och ST längst ned på sidan ”Lediga jobb och intresseanmälan” på migrationsverket.se: Frågor och svar om att söka jobb på Migrationsverket För att arbeta på Migrationsverket behöver du ha rätt att vistas och arbeta i Sverige på någon av dessa grunder: svenskt medborgarskap (krav för vissa tjänster), nordiskt medborgarskap, EU-medborgarskap eller permanent uppehållstillstånd. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter, eller annan information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd, ska du kontakta rekrytering@migrationsverket.se innan du gör din ansökan så berättar vi mer om våra säkerhetsrutiner. Migrationsverkets behandling av personuppgifter Migrationsverkets rekryteringar sker helt i vår egen eller upphandlade leverantörers regi. Vi ber därför om att inte få telefonsamtal och mejl från rekryteringsföretag och annonsförsäljare.


Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Norrköping eller Linköping | Län: Östergötlands län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: MVA-2025-00507 | Kontakt: Teodor Axén 0733617384, | Publicerat: 2025-12-23 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-01-18

title: Senior AI Engineer
description:
**Join us!**
------------


We’re always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply.

### **About the role**


As a Senior AI Engineer**,** you will play a pivotal role in reshaping how businesses operate through the strategic use of Data and AI. This role is about reimagining how organizations compete and grow in the digital era.

  

You will design and deliver advanced AI solutions, with a strong focus on Generative AI, aligned with Futurice’s global vision and local strategy of driving measurable business impact. Working closely with clients, you will uncover real opportunities, co-create innovative approaches, and bring them to life—turning ambition into tangible results.


**What you’ll do**

* Design, develop, and implement innovative AI solutions, with a strong focus on Generative AI
* Explore and experiment with the latest advancements in Generative AI, including autonomous agents, systematic AI evaluation, advanced RAG architectures, and multimodal UX
* Lead the technical direction and delivery for AI projects, collaborating with AI engineers, data engineers, and developers
* Explore and experiment with the latest advancements in Generative AI such as LLMs, diffusion models, and related technologies
* Develop reusable assets and tools to support scalable client delivery
* Collaborate closely with strategists, designers, and other technical experts
* Stay up to date with trends and advancements in AI and proactively identify innovation opportunities
* Contribute to client proposals, discussions, and presentations
* Take initiative and drive projects forward to deliver great client outcomes

**Who we’re looking for**

* Strong foundation in data science, machine learning, and AI
* Strong programming skills,for example in Python.
* Experience evaluating and optimizing Generative AI applications
* Genuine passion for Generative AI and real-world applications
* Experience with frameworks and technologies used to build Generative AI solutions
* A growth mindset and eagerness to learn
* Proven ability to deliver results and make things happen
* Strong problem-solving skills and creativity
* Strong teamwork and collaboration skills
* Good communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences

**Ideally, you also have**

* Experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP)
* Full-stack capabilities
* Experience with retrieval systems, especially RAG
* Familiarity with data engineering
* Consulting experience or strong interest in business problem-solving with AI

**Experience in any of the following is a plus:**

* Docker
* CI/CD
* Haystack
* Open WebUI
* FastAPI
* JavaScript

### **Futurice offers you**


At Futurice, we support your growth as a professional and as a person. You’ll work on a diverse portfolio of projects with motivated, multi-talented colleagues across technology, design, and strategy.  

In addition, we offer:

* A hybrid work model
* Free choice of work equipment (laptop, phone, accessories)
* Sports and lunch benefits
* Futurice clubs and community activities
* Learning events and certification programs

### **Compensation**


Your compensation package will be discussed during the recruitment process. Our salary model is based on skills, responsibilities, and impact, with a fixed salary and the possibility of performance-based bonuses.

### **Next steps**


If this sounds like the opportunity you’ve been looking for, we’d love to hear from you. Our application process is simple: submit your contact details, CV, and a few lines about yourself and why you want to join Futurice. You’re also welcome to share links to LinkedIn or a portfolio.

  

Our recruitment process typically includes an initial conversation, an in-depth discussion with future colleagues, and a final general chat. Reference checks are a natural part of the process.

### **What it’s like to work here**


Ever since Futurice was founded, we’ve focused on creating a workplace people genuinely enjoy, Mondays included. As a community, we’ve built and continue to shape a healthy, welcoming culture where you’re met with trust and kindness, and where your well-being is valued every bit as much as the great work you do. The atmosphere is open, warm, and buzzing with ideas and good conversations. You’ll quickly make friends, and grabbing a coffee or spending time together after work happens naturally.


And because our culture is shaped by all of us, every day, you’ll have the freedom to influence how we work, connect, and evolve as a community. Each of our offices also brings its own character to the mix.


At Futurice, new joiners aren’t expected to fit into a mold. Come as you are, whatever your background. We believe in the power of different perspectives, and diversity is a key part of our success. You can read more about our DE&I commitment here.

title: UX writing expert with a strategic mindset
description:
**Who we believe you are**


You’re a senior content professional with user experience at your core. You know that words aren’t just decoration, they’re part of the experience, and they help people move forward with confidence.


You turn complexity into clarity. You can write microcopy that’s simple, consistent, and human. And you enjoy building the structure behind it: tone of voice, UX patterns, content principles, and decisions that scale across teams, products, and channels.


You bring breadth as well as depth. UX writing is your main craft, but you’re also comfortable stepping into broader content roles: shaping web content, sharpening key messages, supporting content strategy and taking responsibility for production, product planning when needed. We work across many types of assignments, and you enjoy switching between product flows and broader communication, without losing the thread.


You’re curious about tech and AI. You like tools that reduce friction, strengthen consistency, and speed up iteration especially when many teams, languages, or touchpoints are involved. You collaborate closely with designers and developers, and you’re happy to explore smarter workflows (like terminology support, tone checks, and content QA) when they improve the work.

**In your assignments, you can expect to:**

* Create and evolve tone of voice and UX writing systems (principles, guidelines, naming, patterns, component-based writing)
* Contribute to broader content work across copywriting, web content, and content strategy from shaping pages to setting direction and improving structure
* Drive or support localization to keep content usable, relevant, and consistent across markets and languages
* Facilitate workshops to build alignment across product, design, tech, brand, and legal so decisions stick
* Own planning and delivery within content workstreams (scope, priorities, coordination, quality)
* Coach colleagues through collaboration, reviews, and shared method
* Strengthen how we deliver content by developing practical templates and AI-supported workflows, for example, tone and terminology checks, scalable guidelines, and faster iteration without losing quality

  

**Requirements**
* 8+ years of experience in UX writing/content design, copywriting, content strategy, digital communication, or strategic consulting—with clear hands-on delivery
* Deep expertise in UX writing, with a willingness to contribute across copy, web, and content strategy when assignments call for it
* A track record of creating content that supports both user needs and business goals
* Experience building and maintaining tone of voice, writing guidelines, UX patterns, and scalable content structures
* Strong presentation and facilitation skills, comfortable advising senior stakeholders
* Experience with coaching colleagues and raising quality through feedback and collaboration
* Fluency in Swedish and English, with excellent writing skills in both
* Practical experience in modern content environments, such as:
* Figma (UX writing in design systems, components, and handoff)
* AI-supported writing and governance workflows (e.g., Gemini, Gemini Gems, Custom GPTs, Copilot Agents), used thoughtfully for consistency, terminology, and quality checks
* Editing and production tools such as Grammarly and Canva
* Working closely with developers and content platforms (structured content, CMS, localization workflows, or component-based publishing)
* Comfortable navigating complex organizations and working closely with clients, including on-site collaboration
* Consulting experience is a plus, as is strong commercial acume

**What Curious Mind can offer you**  

  

We are content consultants born in the digital era, where strategy and thoughtful production go hand in hand. We work closely with our clients and believe in genuine, long-term relationships. As a senior expert, you’ll shape client outcomes, support colleagues’ growth, and help move our practice forward.

 **Here’s what we’re offering:**

* Leadership development opportunities and personal coaching
* Competitive compensation, performance incentives, and comprehensive benefits
* Access to Eidra’s extensive network of specialists across strategy, design, and technology
* The opportunity to influence our direction and help build new service offerings
* A platform for thought leadership and industry recognition
* Flexible working arrangements that support your goals

Ready to create communication that cuts through the noise, while keeping end users and business goals in focus?


If you have questions, contact Marica Rosengren: marica.rosengren@curiousmind.se. If you’d like to learn more about Curious Mind, please visit our website.


We interview on an ongoing basis.

title: iOS Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*

 **Essential requirements:**  

* Swift, UIKit & SwiftUI Proficiency: Solid experience building iOS apps using Swift and SwiftUI. Senior candidates should demonstrate deep expertise and guide others in advanced UI development.
* Architecture & Design Patterns: Understanding of MVVM or similar patterns. Senior developers are expected to lead architectural decisions and design scalable solutions.
* iOS SDK Knowledge: Familiarity with key frameworks like UIKit, Core Data, and Core Animation. Senior candidates should know how to integrate these effectively with SwiftUI.
* UI/UX Collaboration: Ability to work closely with designers to deliver intuitive, polished interfaces. Seniors should provide design feedback and ensure pixel-perfect implementation.
* Performance & Optimization: Experience identifying performance bottlenecks and using tools like Instruments. Senior developers should lead to optimization efforts.
* Networking & API Integration: Comfortable working with RESTful APIs, async calls, and error handling. Seniors should design robust networking layers.
* Debugging Skills: Strong troubleshooting abilities using Xcode tools. Senior developers should handle complex issues and support others in debugging.
* Team Contribution: Mid-level developers should be collaborative and open to learning. Senior developers are expected to mentor, lead code reviews, and foster team growth.
* Communication: Clear communicators who can work effectively across teams. Senior candidates should also drive technical discussions and decision-making.

  

  

**Last day to apply**: 07-01-2026 **About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Product Design Team Lead
description:
### **Position Overview**


Silverspin operates multiple brands worldwide and leads the industry in AI-powered product experiences, automation, and next-generation digital design. We’re looking for a Design Team Lead who can elevate our product craft, drive UX/UI excellence, and lead a high-performing team in delivering world-class web and app experiences.


Your role will be to lead the central product design function and the end-to-end UX and UI across Silverspin’s global product portfolio. Drive research, testing, prototyping, design systems, and continuous optimisation. Build an AI-enabled operation that increases speed, reduces repetitive effort, and enhances design quality across all markets.

### **Key Responsibilities**

**Leadership**

* Lead and develop a team of three product designers.
* Set clear standards for craft, quality, accessibility, and consistency.
* Build a culture of critique, iteration, experimentation, and high performance.
* Define predictable workflows, delivery expectations, and operating principles.
* Coach designers across research, UX & UI craft, and systems thinking.

**Product Design Excellence**

* Lead the full UX lifecycle: discovery, research, flows, wireframes, prototypes, final UI, and implementation support.
* Use behavioural analytics, heatmaps, funnels, and experiments to guide decisions.
* Run usability testing, rapid validation, and continuous optimisation.
* Ensure user journeys across acquisition, onboarding, gameplay, and account flows are intuitive, fast, and conversion led.
* Maintain strong alignment with product owners on problem definition, requirements, and solution validation.

**Design Systems & UX Consistency**

* Own and evolve the global design system across brands and markets.
* Create engineering-ready components and patterns that ensure coherence and reduce delivery friction.
* Ensure accessibility, responsiveness, and performance standards are met.
* Maintain documentation, usage guidelines, and scalable component libraries.

**AI & Workflow Automation**

* Champion AI in product design: AI wireframing, UI exploration, prototyping, and design automation.
* Identify opportunities to reduce repetitive tasks through templates, systemisation, and smart tooling.
* Adopt and evaluate new AI tools that improve speed, quality, and scalability.
* Foster a culture of AI-enabled design experimentation across the team.

**Cross-Functional Collaboration**

* Product: discovery, roadmap shaping, experimentation, and feature design.
* Engineering: design system implementation, UI QA, and consistent build quality.
* Brand: ensure product design reflects brand identity without compromising UX.
* Data & Performance: integrate insights, behavioural analytics, and experimentation frameworks into design decisions.

### **Requirements**

* 6 + years in product design with a strong UX/UI portfolio.
* 3 + years in managing and growing a high-performing product design team.
* Advanced proficiency in Figma (components, tokens, systems, prototyping).
* Experience building and maintaining design systems at scale.
* Strong understanding of behavioural analytics and experimentation.
* Hands-on experience using AI tools for design exploration or workflow automation.
* Excellent communication and ability to work closely with product and engineering.
* Ability to manage multiple streams with clarity, speed, and attention to detail.
* A proactive mindset focused on quality, scalability, and continuous improvement.
* Experience in working with tools like Maze and Fullstory

 *The above duties provide a generic description of the Employee’s day to day responsibilities but should in no way be deemed to be an exhaustive list. Additional related, duties may be assigned by the Line Manager in line with business exigencies and continuity.*

### **Why Work With Us?**


At Silverspin, we’re not just about work—we’re about passion, innovation, and community. Joining us means you’ll be part of a team that celebrates creativity, supports professional growth, and values every voice. We’re committed to making Silverspin a place where you’ll be excited to come to work every day (and maybe have a little fun along the way!). We offer:

* Competitive Salary & Benefits
* Growth & Development Opportunities
* Creative and Collaborative Environment


Silverspin is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
##### **Create Your Better Tomorrow**


With over 50 years of experience in the industry, Kollmorgen, a Regal Rexnord brand, is a technology leader in navigation and fleet control of automated guided vehicles (AGVs) and autonomous mobile robots (AMRs). In our continued effort to innovate and grow, we are now expanding and are seeking talents to join us and be part of our success story.


Our definition of success goes beyond customer satisfaction; it includes fostering the talent of tomorrow. At Kollmorgen, we cultivate a collaborative and inclusive environment where innovation thrives and every individual is valued. Our commitment to professional growth and development ensures that you will have the opportunity to advance your career while working on cutting-edge automation solutions.

##### **We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to be part of a dynamic team that is passionate about making a difference in the world of AGVs and AMRs.**

##### **Position Overview**


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be part of our Engineering department, along with the other 80+ engineers working within embedded systems, system software as well as windows applications and web services.


In this position, you will be a key player in our Tools team which develops intuitive, high impact tools for our partners to design, configure, and commission AGV & AMR systems. These tools enable our partners to design the system and subsequently install and calibrate the systems at the customer sites. Your primary focus will be the development of our web & cloud-based tool, supporting tasks such as environment validation, vehicle calibration, drive path validation, and pallet positioning.


The mission of this position is to build intuitive and reliable tools that empower our partners to optimize system performance and reliability. To achieve this, you will work across the full stack, developing both frontend and backend components, from responsive user interfaces to scalable backend services and cloud integrations.

##### **Tech Stack:**

**Backend:** C# .NET 8+, ASP.NET Core, Entity Framework Core, REST API's

**Frontend:** React, TypeScript, JavaScript, Material UI

**Cloud:** Microsoft Azure (App Services, Functions, SQL, Storage, SignalR, Communication services)

##### **What does success look like in this position:**

* **High Code Quality:** Deliver clean, efficient, and well-tested code that meets functional requirements and supports continuous integration and automated testing goals.
* **Comprehensive Documentation:** Maintain detailed and up-to-date documentation for all projects, facilitating smooth onboarding and knowledge transfer.
* **Customer-Centric Delivery:** Prioritize building MVPs that deliver real value quickly, balancing technical feasibility with user needs to reduce time-to-market without sacrificing quality.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Work closely with product owners, UX designers, system architects, and other teams to align requirements, solve integration challenges, and contribute to system-level planning.
* **AI usage:** Adoption of Generative AI technologies in our solutions.
* **Agile Leadership & Mentorship:** Actively share knowledge, support junior engineers through pairing and code reviews, and help the team adopt agile practices that improve autonomy and delivery speed.

##### **To achieve the mission and success of this position, we believe you already have:**

* Educational background in Computer science, IT, Engineering, or equivalent;
* 10 years of experience in Software Development and/or working with AGV systems;
* Extensive knowledge in C# and .NET;
* Solid experience working with Azure cloud solutions;
* Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written;
* Strong collaboration skills;
* Ability to anticipate, address, and solve complex problems;
* Commitment to high standards and continuous quality improvement;
* Drive to challenge the status quo to create breakthrough innovations;
* Flexibility and adaptability in changing circumstances;
* Experience working with AGVs and AMRs is considered beneficial.


We see that our ideal candidates are committed to personal & professional growth, and they share our core values and genuine enthusiasm for innovation.

##### **Additional Information**


Full time employment | Based in Mölndal, Sweden


Selection takes place on an ongoing basis, so be sure to apply early. We're excited to hear from you!


Please submit your application in English.

##### **Kollmorgen - Autonomous Mobile Solutions**


We offer a complete automation solution for AGV and AMR providers. Our NDC Solutions platform is a proven platform that enables efficient and reliable vehicle automation with increased performance. It includes all hardware, software, and navigation technologies necessary to automate a vehicle fleet. The platform has been installed in a vast variety of material handling sites and vehicles across the globe.

title: Senior Frontend Engineer (Music Experience)
description:
**About us**
------------


Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble engineers, designers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.

**The Role**
------------


We’re looking for a **Senior Frontend Engineer** to join the Music Experience team at Soundtrack. The Music Experience team is a key part of our product development and is responsible for how our users discover music and create playlists.


As a Senior Frontend Engineer in the Music Experience team, you’ll work on a wide range of user-centric projects together with engineers, product owners, UI/UX designers, machine learning experts, researchers, music experts, and analysts.


Your primary focus will be on building new features and continuously improving our applications built with **React and React Native (TypeScript)**. We are a **data-driven team** and iterate continuously based on insights, A/B testing, and qualitative user feedback.


You can check out the How it works page to see what kind of features you will be working on or download our app and sign up for a free trial to get a first-hand experience.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Building, releasing, and continuously improving existing features together with UI/UX designers, researchers, and analysts
* Developing and maintaining consistent and reusable UI components and libraries used by multiple teams
* Contributing to the team’s vision, strategy, and agenda
* Helping the team grow as a whole by sharing knowledge and lifting each other up

**About You**
-------------


Just like us, you love music. You're driven and entrepreneurial, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and with a passion for details.

* Communicative and easy to work with
* Self-driven and proactive – you take initiative and deliver results
* Adaptable and comfortable in a changing environment
* Pragmatic and methodical in your approach
* Curious and eager to learn new technologies

**Requirements**
----------------

* At least 4 years of professional experience working with JavaScript and TypeScript in production environments
* Experience building and maintaining production-grade web and/or mobile applications
* Hands-on experience with React and React Native
* Ability to translate design concepts into high-quality, well-implemented user interfaces
* Comfortable with Git, Node, (p)npm and React Native/Browser development tools

**Beneficial Requirements**
---------------------------

* General interest in music and/or music technology
* iOS, Android, Mac, and/or Windows app development
* Modern, accessible and performant web development
* GraphQL APIs and libraries (we use Apollo client and GraphQL federation)
* Automated testing
* Knowledge of functional programming
* Experience setting up JS tooling like Vite / Expo / Nx or similar
* Backend development (the Music Experience backend is primarily built in Python)

**Employee Benefits**
---------------------

* We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office


At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.


We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.


If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Petter Machado at petter@soundtrack.io. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.


We will be back reviewing and answering applications in mid-January 2026. Until then, have a wonderful holiday and a Happy New Year!

title: Junior Web Coordinator & CRM Assistant
description:
**About SNS**
 SNS is a multibrand sneaker retailer built on curation, culture, and community. What started with a deep, nerd-like knowledge of product has grown into a platform where sneakers meet music, art, and basketball - connecting people through shared stories and passion. Behind every drop, every product launch, and every story we tell, there’s a digital layer focused on execution - bringing prepared products and launches to life on our Shopify stores and ensuring they reach our customers clearly, accurately, and on time. That´s where you come in.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Junior Web Coordinator & CRM Assistant, you’ll be at the heart of SNS’s daily e-com operations. Working closely with marketing and operations teams, you’ll help push products and launches live, maintain on-site accuracy, and provide an extra set of eyes across product presentation, collections, content etc in Shopify.
   

  

 You’ll also support CRM activities in Klaviyo, helping ensure product launches, updates and campaigns are communicated clearly and consistently to our community. From checking product data and visuals to assisting with launch execution and post-launch follow-ups, this role plays a key part in how customers experience SNS every day.
   

  

 This position is ideal for someone early in their e-commerce career - hungry to learn, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. You may already have a couple of years of experience in a similar operational, digital, or retail setup and are ready to grow your skills within a brand where execution matters just as much as creativity. The salary range for the role is: 27.000 – 30.000 SEK/month.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Merchandising products across collection pages
* Assisting with the creation and maintenance of collection pages
* Assisting with product publishing and release processes, ensuring products go live on time for hard launch dates and campaign-led releases
* Taking proactive actions to support sales opportunities
* Assisting with analyzing slow-moving items, identifying actions and following up accordingly
* Assisting with price competitiveness analysis and related adjustments
* Reviewing and resolving on-site issues such as 404 pages and similar errors
* Acting as an extra set of eyes to ensure product names, information, copy and pricing are accurate on site
* Assisting with on-site content coordination
* Assisting with campaign and flow creation in Klaviyo


**Who You Are**
 You’re positive, proactive, and a hands-on doer who takes responsibility for your tasks and follows through. You’re comfortable working independently within clear frameworks, while knowing when to ask questions or align with others.
   

  

 You thrive in a fast-paced environment, enjoy having a lot going on and keep a strong eye on detail without losing momentum. You’re confident working across digital tools and systems and experience with Shopify, Klaviyo, or similar platforms is highly meritorious, as is confidence in Excel and knowledge of Adobe tools such as Photoshop.
   

  

 Most importantly, you get what SNS is about. You understand that behind every product there’s a story — and that strong day-to-day execution is what brings those stories to life.

title: Content & Product Manager
description:
**Vill du vara med och utveckla en av Sveriges mest besökta webbplatser – och skapa engagerande innehåll som når miljontals användare?** 




 Brinner du för språk, engagerande innehåll och användarupplevelse? Då kan denna roll vara helt rätt för dig. Vi erbjuder en möjlighet att arbeta både med Synonymer.se – en av Sveriges mest använda språktjänster och ett av landets största digitala konsumentvarumärken – och att stärka den digitala närvaron för Tankesport, Sveriges ledande aktör inom korsord och hjärngympa.
 



 Du blir en del av ett digitalt team som kombinerar kreativt skapande med datadriven utveckling – och där dina idéer snabbt kan göra skillnad.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Content & Product Manager arbetar du operativt med innehåll, analys och produktförbättringar. Du skapar engagerande innehåll, följer upp hur det tas emot och arbetar tillsammans med utvecklare för att förbättra funktioner och användarupplevelse. Rollen passar dig som trivs med eget ansvar, högt tempo och att vara en drivande “doer”.
 



  





**Dina ansvarsområden:** 




  





**Synonymer.se** 




 ·      Skapa engagerande och språkrelaterat innehåll som driver användarvärde
 



 ·      Publicera och optimera innehåll i CMS
 



 ·      Sprida utvalt innehåll och initiativ i sociala medier för att öka räckvidd och engagemang
 



 ·      Analysera användarbeteenden via GA4 och ta datadrivna beslut kring innehåll, struktur och funktioner
 



 ·      Samarbeta med utvecklare för att förbättra UX/UI, lansera nya sektioner och iterera på funktioner
 



 ·      Ansvara för att Synonymer.se fortsätter vara en modern, relevant och användarvänlig språktjänst
 



  





**Tankesport** 




 ·      Skapa innehåll och utveckla vår organiska närvaro i sociala medier
 



 ·      Arbeta målgruppsdrivet och identifiera vilka budskap, format och teman som fungerar för olika segment
 



 ·      Följa upp resultat och optimera baserat på data och insikter
 



 ·      Bidra till att stärka Tankesport som varumärke och öka användarengagemang
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Du är kreativ, nyfiken och självgående, med en tydlig känsla för språk och vad som engagerar digitala målgrupper. Du kombinerar operativ kraft med analytisk förmåga och är trygg i att testa, mäta och vidareutveckla.
 



  





**Krav** 




 ·      Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska
 



 ·      Goda kunskaper i engelska
 



 ·      Intresse för språk och språkligt innehåll
 



 ·      Erfarenhet av att skapa innehåll för sociala medier
 



 ·      Erfarenhet av CMS-arbete
 



 ·      Vana att arbeta i GA4 eller motsvarande verktyg
 



 ·      Förmåga att arbeta datadrivet med fokus på UX och användarbeteenden
 



  





**Meriterande** 




 ·      Erfarenhet av UX/UI-arbete
 



 ·      Erfarenhet av att samarbeta med utvecklare
 



 ·      Vana av att producera olika innehållsformat (text, enklare grafik, kortvideo)
 



 ·      Kunskaper i danska eller finska
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 ·      Möjlighet att påverka och utveckla en av Sveriges mest använda digitala tjänster
 



 ·      En nyckelroll i ett digitalt team med stora ambitioner
 



 ·      Moderna lokaler och en välkomnande arbetsmiljö
 



 ·      Ett expansivt företag som utvecklas snabbt
 



 ·      En roll där du får arbeta kreativt, operativt och nära teknikutveckling
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Ansökningar granskas löpande och tjänsten tillsätts så snart som möjligt, med hänsyn till uppsägningstid.

title: Senior Product Design Lead
description:
At Anyfin, we believe finance should work in favor of the consumer – not the other way around. That’s why we build smart, transparent and customer-first solutions that make everyday finances easier and fairer.
   

  

 But we aim higher: more customers, products, markets… all of which need a well-designed, flawless experience. That’s why we’re currently looking for a
 **Senior Product Design Lead** 
 to join us and elevate our product experience across the board.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a Senior Product Design Lead at Anyfin, you will drive the vision, quality, and execution of the design experience across multiple product areas. You connect design quality to strategy and measurable business results.
   

  

 You will lead the Product Design team while working hands-on the majority of your time. When we say lead, we mean
 *by example* 
 : you maintain a high bar for visual and interaction design and bring clarity to complex problem spaces. You’re a true player/coach — someone who can zoom into the finer details of the craft while coaching others to raise our collective output.
   

  

 Collaboration is central to the role. You don’t just work closely with Product, Engineering, and Marketing—you define and evolve the ways of working across discovery, delivery, and validation, ensuring what we ship is beautiful, intuitive, strategically aligned, and measurably impactful. You will guide teams through discovery, delivery, and validation and help break down complex financial concepts into clear, elegant, user-friendly experiences.
   

  

 Your work will have a direct impact on how customers interact with their finances, and your contributions will play a big part in our mission of making financial well-being happen.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for someone who thrives at the intersection of leadership, craft, and strategic thinking — someone who elevates the team while pushing the quality of the product experience forward. Here’s what we’re looking for:
   

  

* You have deep experience leading product design in fast-paced environments and are comfortable guiding multiple product areas at once. Fintech or financial services experience is a bonus.
* You bring a deep understanding of UX design patterns and usability principles, and you set a consistently high visual and interaction bar.
* You excel at translating complex problems into simple, elegant, user-centric solutions.
* You have strong native mobile design expertise, from navigation patterns to platform conventions.
* You lead cross‑functional collaboration with Product, Engineering, and Marketing, aligning stakeholders and decisions across multiple product areas.
* You’re comfortable defining and running product discovery and validation activities and tying design decisions directly to business goals and measurable outcomes.
* You design within regulatory and compliance constraints (e.g., KYC/AML, disclosures) without sacrificing clarity or user experience.
* You’re comfortable defining and running product discovery and validation activities, and you consistently link design decisions to business goals and measurable outcomes.
* You have experience designing within regulatory or compliance constraints without sacrificing user experience.
* You have experience owning or scaling design systems — ensuring accessibility, consistency, and efficiency across teams.


**What We Offer**
 We offer you the chance to be part of something truly meaningful. You’ll work alongside colleagues in Product, Engineering, Marketing, Credit, Operations and more — giving you a broad playground to influence and shape. We promise you’ll be challenged, supported, and given work that truly matters.
   

  

 Beyond the mission, we offer a competitive compensation package, a centrally located and cozy office, extra time off on your birthday, and plenty of other benefits along the way.
   

  

 If you’re ready to help build the future of user-centric financial products, click “Apply” below.
   

  

 We can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

***PS: During the holiday season things will slow down so be patient with us and we will be getting back to everyone applying as soon as we possibly can once we are back.***
 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Product Manager
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
 Do you want to shape the future of property management technology across the globe? We’re looking for a Product Manager to lead the ongoing development & implementation of our new Asset & maintenance management solution. This is an exciting new software area for our industry that will change the way buildings around the world are managed. It is a green field product built with the users in mind and on a “best of breed” technology stack that is just at the start of a wider implementation for the US, with the potential for more global presence in the coming years.
   

  

 As a Product Manager within asset management, you will play a key role in creating highly usable & scalable solutions that track the components (assets) that require active maintenance and lifecycle management in the buildings Odevo manage. This is a critical task to ensure the value of our properties is preserved and will help us to build further trust and value delivery with owners and boards in the properties Odevo manages. The solution you will work on has global potential with opportunities across multiple markets. You will work closely together with the Head of AM Product to define and maintain a clear roadmap and sprint priorities, translate user needs into user stories with acceptance criteria, and identify cross-market opportunities.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Own and refine the product backlog with the development team (user stories, acceptance criteria, definition of done).
* Plan sprint priorities & facilitate agile ceremonies (planning, review, retro).
* Communicate with key end users and internal stakeholders on priorities and progress.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure product development meets market and customer needs. Work with UX Lead to analyse user behavior & adoption (instrument usage, gather feedback, iterate)
* Collaborate with the product team on defining the broader roadmap & strategy for the product
* Lead feature launches and drive successful adoption (enablement, internal demos, follow-up).
* Visualise the ongoing and planned work to relevant stakeholders incl. internal senior mgmt. and customer representatives.
* Track outcomes with agreed KPIs/OKRs and surface risks/trade-offs early.


**Who You Are**
* Have a curious mindset & interest in user behavior
* Demonstrated stakeholder management skills, capable of engaging and influencing at various organizational levels.
* A natural relationship builder with clear, pedagogical communication.
* Skilled in prioritizing tasks, and good at shifting focus while maintaining a keen attention to detail.
* Proficient in prioritizing using both qualitative and quantitative methods to explain complex trade-offs, securing clear conclusions and consensus.
* Practical “Product owner” experience from driving a product development team's daily work
* Hands-on Product Owner with experience running the day-to-day of a product development team.
* Comfortable with modern product tooling (e.g., Jira/Linear, Figma, basic analytics)


**What We Are Looking For**
* A natural leader and relationship builder, adept at interacting with diverse functions and individuals in a clear, pedagogical manner.
* A team leader that is perceived as a true owner and natural go-to person for a product domain
* Skilled at prioritizing and balancing multiple focuses with attention to detail.
* Comfortable making data-driven trade-offs and achieving alignment across teams.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.


**Relevant Experience**
* 5+ years as a Product Manager, Product Owner or similar product leadership roles in B2B SaaS or services
* Experience in PropTech or service industry product development is a plus.
* Bachelors degree in relevant field is preferred
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Proficiency in Spanish is a plus


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!

title: Konsult inom Product Compliance
description:
**Därför är detta jobb för dig**
 Som strategisk partner inom produkt- och tjänsteutveckling till våra kunder är en av våra viktigaste uppgifter att utveckla produkter som inte vara är innovativa – utan också säkra, hållbara och redo för en global marknad.
 



 Som konsult inom product compliance kliver du in i hjärtat av modern produktutveckling och arbetar tvärfunktionellt med hela organisationen för att säkerställa att regulatoriska krav under hela utvecklingsprocessen blir en möjliggörare för effektiv utveckling.
 



 Du blir del av vårt affärsområde Compliance & Management där vi stöttar en effektiv omställning till digitala, hållbara och säkra lösningar genom expertkunskap inom exempelvis kvalitet, säkerhet, hållbarhet och projektstyrning.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Rollen är för dig som känner igen dig i nedan:
 


* Du vill bidra till utvecklingen av framtidens produkter och i förlängningen en säkrare, hållbarare och modernare värld.
* Du tycker det är spännande att hitta rätt balans mellan kvalitet och regulatorisk efterlevnad under produktutvecklingsprocessen
* Du har god uppfattning kring hur kravställning är i balans med affären både reaktivt som proaktivt.
* Du är en naturlig ledare som kan ta ägandeskap och driva egna arbetsströmmar.
* Du vill använda hela din kompetens i varierande projekt, från start-ups till väletablerade internationella företag.
* Du värdesätter att arbeta i en miljö präglad av tillit, transparens och samarbete.



**Kvalifikationer**
 Din förmåga att leda våra kunder inom nuvarande och framtida regulatoriska krav är viktig. Lika viktig är din förmåga att vilja lära nytt och stärka dina kollegor genom att dela kunskap. Då vår ambition är att hjälpa våra kunder ta nästa steg in i framtiden, ser vi att du har intresse och kompetens inom ny teknik, mjukvara cybersäkerhet och digitalisering. Du har även:
 


* Ingenjörsexamen.
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med product compliance inom fordonsbranschen eller annan produktutvecklande industri, samt har kompetens inom exempelvis CE-märkning, riskanalyser (FMEA/HARA), dokumentation och tekniska filer.


* Erfarenhet av arbete med mjukvara och dess påverkan på regulatorisk efterlevnad.


* Vi ser positivt på bred kunskap inom bland annat dessa regulatoriska krav och standarder - Maskinförordningen, Radiodirektivet, Batteriförordningen, IEC61508, Cybersäkerhet.
* Flytande kunskaper i både svenska och engelska.



**En spännande resa med Knightec Group**
 Semcon och Knightec har gått samman som Knightec Group. Tillsammans bildar vi Norra Europas ledande strategiska partner inom produkt- och digital tjänsteutveckling – hur häftigt är inte det?
 



 Med en unik kombination av tvärfunktionell expertis och en holistisk förståelse för affärer hjälper vi våra kunder att förverkliga sina strategier – från idé till färdig lösning. På Knightec Group finns kompetensen, attityden och drivkraften som krävs för att anta de mest utmanande och innovativa projekten.
 



 För våra medarbetare innebär detta fantastiska möjligheter att vara med och forma framtiden genom meningsfulla projekt i teknikens absoluta framkant. Här får du inte bara utvecklas och växa, utan också bli en del av något större.
 



 Låter det som platsen för dig? Häng med på en spännande resa!
 



**Praktisk information**
 Detta är en tillsvidareanställning med en provanställning på sex månader, placerad på något av våra kontor i Stockholm. Hagaplan 4 (Forskaren) eller Rättarvägen 3 (Solna). Resor i tjänsten kan förekomma till våra kunder. Startdatum är så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
 



 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 2026-01-25. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Talent Acquisition Specialist, Kicki Björ.
 



 Vi hanterar alla ansökningar via vår karriärsida för att säkerställa en trygg och säker hantering av dina personuppgifter i enlighet med GDPR.
 



 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Tjänstespecialist
description:
Inera är ett digitaliseringsbolag som bidrar till att utveckla välfärden. Vi är Sveriges digitala ingång till hälsa, vård och omsorg och utvecklar digital infrastruktur för en sammanhållen välfärd. Vi arbetar på uppdrag av kommuner och regioner. Vår vision är världens mest innovativa och omtänksamma välfärd.
   

  

 För att kunna upprätthålla hög kvalitet inom hälsa, vård och omsorg måste välfärden utvecklas, med oförändrade eller minskade resurser. Genom digitalisering – att förändra strukturer, beteenden och arbetssätt med stöd av digital teknik – kan flera av välfärdens utmaningar mötas. Det gör Ineras uppdrag viktigare än någonsin.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och skapa en nationell tjänst som gör skillnad för elever, vårdnadshavare och landets alla kommuner och antagningskanslier?
   

  

 Hos Inera Får Du Chansen Att Bidra Till En Modern Digital Lösning För Gymnasieantagning. Gymnasieantagning Är En Komplex Verksamhet, Och Många Antagningskanslier Saknar Idag Adekvat Digitalt Stöd. Nu Får Du Möjlighet Att Vara Med Och Etablera Och Förvalta En Nationell Lösning Som
   

  

* Skapar trygghet och stabilitet i hela processen
* Effektiviserar samarbetet mellan antagningskanslier
* Möjliggör säker delning av data mellan kommuner
* Minskar kostnader och arbetsbelastning för personalen
* Ger bättre beslutsunderlag och statistik
* Gör ansökningsprocessen smidigare och mer transparent för elever och vårdnadshavare


**Om rollen** 
  

  

 I rollen som tjänstespecialist arbetar du nära både kund och användare, med ansvar för att förstå kundens verksamhet och omsätta dem till tydliga och värdeskapande krav för vidareutveckling av tjänsten. Du fungerar som en brygga mellan kundens verksamhet och den tekniska förvaltningen. I rollen ansvarar du för behovs- och kravanalys av funktionella och icke-funktionella krav. Du är en del av ett agilt team som består av tjänsteansvarig, produktägare, systemspecialist, UX och test samt ett applikationsutvecklingsteam med flera kompetenser. I arbetsuppgifterna inkluderar även testning, uppdatering av användarmanualer och informationsspridning.
   

  

 Du är expert på hur tjänsten du arbetar med fungerar och stöttar våra kunder i frågeställningar. Det innebär att du även bidrar vid anslutning och införande av tjänsten, hjälper befintliga kunder vid frågor och arbetar aktivt med ärenden inom andra linjens support. Du representerar tjänsten i olika forum, såsom kundforum och referensgrupper och är med och formar tjänstens långsiktiga utveckling och strategi tillsammans med tjänsteteamet.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Du har relevant högskoleutbildning, exempelvis inom systemvetenskap, eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet. Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med agil tjänste- eller produktförvaltning, med fokus på behov- och kravanalys. Erfarenhet från att ha arbetat inom antagningsverksamhet är meriterande.
   

  

**Varaktighet och tillträde** 
  

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Intervjuer kommer ske löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstidens slut.
   

  

**Frågor om rollen?** 
  

  

 Helena Ardehed, sektionschef, helena.ardehed@inera.se
   

  

*Fackliga frågor (Vision), Monica Rosén,* 
 monica.rosen@inera.se
   

  

 Inera är ett digitaliseringsbolag som på uppdrag av kommuner och regioner bidrar till välfärdens utveckling. Vi är Sveriges digitala ingång till hälsa, vård och omsorg och utvecklar digital infrastruktur för en sammanhållen välfärd.

title: Adaptation Advisor
description:
Vill du vara med och skapa smarta, tekniska lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder? Har du erfarenhet av ERP-system och gillar att kombinera kundkontakt med projektledning? Då är rollen som Adaptation Advisor något för dig!
  
Om rollen
  
Som Adaptation Advisor får du en dynamisk och tekniskt orienterad roll med fokus på kundkontakt, samordning och skräddarsydda lösningar i Monitor ERP. Du hanterar kundförfrågningar, tar fram tekniska specifikationer och offererar kundunika lösningar – allt från mindre uppdrag till större projekt.
  
Du ansvarar för de projekt du säljer och samarbetar nära våra utvecklare för att säkerställa att leveranser sker i tid och inom budget. Vid större projekt kliver du in som projektledare och driver arbetet från start till mål.
  
Du blir en central kontaktpunkt för både kunder och interna och externa parter inom Monitor. Rollen kräver att du har en djup förståelse för ERP-system och kan översätta kundens behov till tekniska lösningar. Du fungerar som länken mellan kundens krav och vår tekniska leverans – din kompetens är avgörande för att skapa rätt lösning.
  
Vem är du
  
Vi söker dig som är driven, kommunikativ och strukturerad, med en stark teknisk grund. Du gillar att ta ansvar, arbeta i en dynamisk miljö och samarbeta med andra. Du är en problemlösare som trivs med att hitta kreativa lösningar för våra kunder.
  
Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet. För att trivas hos oss känner du igen dig i våra värdeord: jordnära, långsiktig och engagerad.
  
  

**För att trivas i rollen bör du känna igen dig i följande:**  

Du har erfarenhet av Monitor ERP eller annat ERP-system.
  
Du har förmåga att förstå och tolka tekniska specifikationer och omsätta dem i praktiska lösningar.
  
Relevant utbildning inom teknik, IT eller systemutveckling eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
  
Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
  
Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från tillverkande industri, IT eller projektledning.
  
  

Om Monitor
  
Hos Monitor blir du en del av ett stabilt, globalt produktbolag med huvudkontor i den natursköna kuststaden Hudiksvall. Vi utvecklar och säljer vårt eget affärssystem, som hjälper små och medelstora tillverkningsföretag att effektivisera sin verksamhet – från sportbilar till julmust. Med cirka 550 anställda globalt (över 300 i Sverige) är vi mitt i en expansiv och spännande fas där internationell tillväxt är vår primära fokus.
  
Varför välja Monitor ERP System?
  
**En passionerad och engagerad kultur:** Vi arbetar tillsammans för att skapa det bästa affärssystemet och ge våra kunder förstklassig service.
  
**En ledare på marknaden:** Monitor är Sveriges mest framstående affärsystemsleverantör och växer stadigt både nationellt och internationellt. Vi har en årlig omsättningstillväxt på ca 17%.
  
**Personlig utveckling i fokus:** Vi tror på att växa tillsammans och investerar i din utveckling. Här hittar du både lokala och internationella karriärmöjligheter.
  
**Hälsa och välmående:** Din hälsa är viktig för oss. Vi satsar på en bra arbetsmiljö och erbjuder förmåner som främjar både fysiskt och psykiskt välbefinnande.
  
**Engagerade medarbetare:** Vi har ett eNPS-värde på 55 (Employee Net Promoter Score mäter engagemang och lojalitet hos medarbetare) där benchmark är -2 (över 20 = mycket bra, över 50 = exceptionellt bra).
  
  

**Mer information om rekryteringsprocessen:**  

**Start:** Enligt överenskommelse
  
**Plats:** Hudiksvall
  
**Ansökan:** Urval och intervjuer kommer att genomföras efter sista ansökningsdag.
  
Monitor strävar efter att erbjuda en arbetsplats som är fri från diskriminering och ger lika möjligheter för alla. Vi ser olikheter som en tillgång och uppmuntrar därför en mångfald av sökande till alla våra tjänster.
  
Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Solution Architect Penta Manufacturing
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and highly collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

  

Are you passionate about digitalization, cutting-edge technology, and thriving in a dynamic, multicultural environment? Do you excel in a high-paced setting and want to be part of a team driving critical transformation? If so, we have the ideal opportunity for you.

**This Is Us – Shaping the Future Together**
--------------------------------------------

You will join a passionate and high-paced team working at the heart of Volvo Group’s transformation. Together, we are building the digital manufacturing system of the future — where data, automation, and people unite to redefine how sustainable power solutions are made and delivered to the world.

  

Our department is on a bold journey, transforming and modernizing our IT landscape to enable Volvo’s vision of becoming a fully agile, data-driven company. With strong investments, cutting-edge technologies, and a shared mindset for continuous improvement, we are creating the digital foundations that will power tomorrow’s production and distribution systems.

  

We are reimagining end-to-end processes, driving transformation, and unlocking the full potential of data to shape smarter, more efficient, and more sustainable operations. Our environment is international, multicultural, and full of opportunities for both personal and professional growth. Our technology stack is diverse and future-oriented, built on a solid mix of COTS (Commercial Off-The-Shelf) and SaaS solutions that we continuously evolve to meet the demands of the next generation of manufacturing.

**Solution Architect for Tomorrow’s Factories**
-----------------------------------------------

As a Solution Architect within Manufacturing, you will be central to Volvo Group’s digital transformation, shaping the solutions that power the factories of tomorrow. You will help us reimagine how technology enables smarter, more efficient, and more sustainable manufacturing across the world.

  

You will take ownership of our manufacturing solution portfolio and work side by side with a community of architects, engineers, and business experts. Together, you will translate ideas into reality, connecting strategy with execution and ensuring every digital initiative creates measurable value for our operations.

  

A Solution Architect acts as the technical strategist and guide—the one who sees the big picture, understands the details, and creates architectural solutions that enhance business efficiency and future-readiness. You combine strategic vision with tactical execution to ensure our digital architecture supports long-term growth and agility.

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

Your days will be dedicated to exploration, creation, and collaboration. You will:

  

* Lead the evolution of our capabilities and value streams, defining and implementing digital strategies that improve manufacturing processes.
* Analyze business needs and translate them into actionable architectural direction.
* Design and implement end-to-end solutions that balance innovation, stability, and future scalability across the entire technology landscape.
* Ensure that all systems work seamlessly together, from user experience to infrastructure.
* Collaborate closely with Business Analysts, Product Owners, and Engineers, aligning technological choices with strategic business goals.
* Guide and mentor teams, helping them adopt modern development practices and architectural thinking.
* Ensure every solution we create is built to last: secure, scalable, and aligned with our long-term digital vision.

 **Your background**

  

* We are seeking a candidate with proven experience and expertise in the following mandatory areas:
* Minimum 5 years of professional experience as a Solution Architect in a large, complex, and global enterprise environment.
* Deep and demonstrable understanding of end-to-end manufacturing processes (including Operations, Planning, Supply Chain, and Warehousing).
* Proven track record of designing, implementing, and governing solutions leveraging both COTS/SaaS platforms and custom-developed systems.
* Strong technical command of architectural best practices for security, scalability, and performance.
* Fluent professional proficiency in English (both written and verbal) is required for global collaboration.
* Willingness to work closely with operations and spend time at the factory level to ensure solutions meet real-world production needs.

  

You are an experienced and forward-thinking professional who thrives where technology meets business. You bring both analytical sharpness and creative curiosity to everything you do. You have a natural drive to solve problems and turn complexity into clarity.

  

You are not only technically skilled but also an effective communicator who can translate intricate technical concepts into meaningful business insights that inspire action. Collaboration is at the heart of how you work. You take ownership, balance multiple priorities with ease, and bring a proactive mindset that drives projects forward in an agile environment.

 **For more information, please contact**


Mikael Zander, Mikael.zander@volvo.com, DPAO Volvo Group Digital & IT

  

Application Deadline: January 19th, 2025.


Note: Due to the holiday period, the application review process will start immediately after the deadline.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.

title: Factory IT support technician to ABB Robotic Campus
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This role sits within ABB's Robotics business, a leading global robotics company. We're entering an exciting new chapter as we’ve announced the plan for SoftBank Group to acquire ABB Robotics. SoftBank is a globally recognized technology group and investor/operator focused on AI, robotics, and next-generation computing. By joining us now, you’ll be part of a pioneering team shaping the future of robotics—working alongside world-class experts in a fast-moving, innovation-driven environment.


This Position reports to:


Dept. manager, PNTI - Factory IT & Digitalization  

As part of building a new ABB Robotics Campus, we have high ambitions in digitalizing our production and create a further fact based organization, to improve productivity and quality. Join our team to create a workplace for the future. As one of seventeen skilled engineers in our Factory IT & Digitalization department, you will be a part of our projects and you will meet a lot of new challenges and opportunities on the way.


Your work involves PC and application support for production, change management, integration, troubleshooting, possibly an application manager role, supplier contacts and incident coordination in our customer's industrial and critical IT environment, where you will be part of a team of support technicians.


A typical workday involves handling incidents within our infrastructure and application components, driving internal and customer‑facing improvements, managing recurring or serious problems to identify root causes, collaborating with production technicians and system suppliers on enhancements, and implementing changes in the systems and services we oversee.


You should be diplomatic, pragmatic, and able to see the bigger picture across applications, integrations, and infrastructure. You’re self‑driven, responsible, solution‑oriented, and open to learning new technologies and new ways of working.


ABB invests SEK 3.1 billion to expand its production capacity in Europe and build a new state-of-the-art European ABB Robotics Campus in Västerås. As part of our "local for local" production strategy, the campus will serve as a hub for ABB Robotics' offering in Europe, providing customers with AI-equipped collaborative and industrial robots as well as digital solutions to enable flexible automation. The new campus, which is planned to be inaugurated at the end of 2026, will replace the existing Robotics facilities in Västerås, Sweden.

**Qualifications**

* Experience with IT infrastructure and production‑grade applications, including troubleshooting and problem analysis
* Understanding of software development processes and ability to work with at least one programming language
* Comfortable managing communication and coordination across different levels of an organization
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
* Preferably a university degree or equivalent practical experience
* Knowledge of Windows 10/11, basic Linux, networking, SQL, and general server management
* Experience with tools and platforms such as Intune, Entra, ServiceNow, and Windows Server
* Ability to produce clear documentation and familiarity with ITIL or similar frameworks

**What’s in it for you?**

  

We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You’ll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that’s tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger.


Our benefits? Competitive, comprehensive, and crafted with you in mind.

**ABB Robotics is looking for our Factory IT support technician!** Union contact persons - Swedish Association of Graduate Engineers: Nicolin Ahlqvist, +4621-34 42 50; Leaders: Lenny Larsson +4621-32 85 47; Unionen: Roger L. Gustavsson +4621-32 90 97. For other questions, please contact Talent Partner Robert Norén +4672-461 20 95.


Does this sound like the next step in your career? Apply today!


The last day to submit your application is 11th of January. Interviews will be held during the advertisement period, the position may be filled during the advertisement period. We look forward to receiving your application and appreciate if both it and the files you attach are in English. To learn more about ABB, visit our website www.abb.com.


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Mjukvaruarkitekt
description:
På Migrationsverket arbetar vi med en av vår tids stora samhällsfrågor – migrationen. Totalt är vi cirka 6 000 personer här, och vi har ett ovanligt viktigt jobb!


Migrationsverkets digitalisering innebär att vi formar om myndighetens IT-miljö från grunden. Just nu pågår bl.a. arbete med att göra om hela dokumenthanteringen och diarieföring. Vi ska gå från det fysiska dokumentet till strukturerad och digitaliserad information. Det här kommer vi göra genom en nyligen införd ärende-modell och en central tjänst för diarieföring. Ett viktigt arbete som kommer påverka all verksamhet.


Teamen du kommer bli en del av arbetar med digitaliserad information – alltså en bärande del av Migrationsverkets utvecklingsavdelning. Information löper genom all verksamhet och utan den står Migrationsverket still. För att våra resterande team ska ha möjlighet att ta framskridande steg i modernisering och automatisering krävs det strukturerad och digitaliserad information i grunden. Detta är kärnuppgiften för teamen.


Vi söker dig som med din gedigna erfarenhet vill vara med och påverka och bidra till samhällsnyttan. Du kan förvänta dig ett omfattande arbete, med en varierande och verksamhetsnära IT-miljö.


I denna roll kommer du att:

* Vägleda inför och under förändringsuppdrag
* Säkerställa att förändringar linjerar med verksamhetens behov och Migrationsverkets målbild för IT-arkitektur.
* Ansvara för att ge förutsättningar för team och medarbetare att leverera lösningar som linjerar med den arkitekturella målbilden
* Vara med och omvandla myndigheten arkitektur så de när redo för framtiden.

**Hos oss** arbetar du tillsammans med de närmsta utvecklingsteamen och arkitektkollegor. Migrationsverket har en arkitekturfunktion som omfattar mjukvaruarkitekter, lösningsarkitekter och verksamhetsarkitekter. Utöver arkitektkollegorna samverkar du även med projektledare, produktansvarig, systemutvecklare, testare, drifttekniker, chefer, kansli, controllers, etc. Dina kontaktytor är många och det nätverk som du kommer att bygga upp är stort.


Vi eftersträvar ett bra arbetsklimat och värdesätter gemenskap där vi lär av varandra, värdesätter varandras olikheter och har en tillåtande kultur. Här kan du höra medarbetare dela sin upplevelse av att arbeta på Migrationsverket: Vi som jobbar här

**Vem är du?**


Som person tror vi att du är trygg, stabil och prestigelös. Du har en förmåga att skilja på det professionella och personliga. Du anpassar dig till situationen och relaterar till andra på ett lyhört sätt. Vidare är du kommunikativ och lätt att samarbeta med. Du tar naturligt en ledarroll som säkerställer att vi på ett effektivt sätt når våra mål i tid. Du är också bra på att planera och organisera ditt arbete och har förmågan att prioritera rätt saker samt har en god analytisk förmåga.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och tester kan tillkomma i rekryteringsprocessen.

**Du som går in i rollen som mjukvaruarkitekt behöver ha**

* En akademisk utbildning inom it/datateknik
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av Java-utveckling
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av Golang-utveckling
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av React, eller motsvarande, frontendramverk.
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling av mikrotjänster i en mikrotjänstarkitektur
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av containerplattformar (Kubernetes / Docker)
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av eventstreaming (Kafka)
* Erfarenhet av Continous Integration / Continous Delivery
* Erfarenhet av system inom dokumenthantering eller diarieföring
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av ledarskap i någon form
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift, eftersom du behöver kunna ta del av och delge komplex information på dessa språk

**Meriterande är erfarenhet av:**

* Certifiering inom arkitektur
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av arkitekturella uppgifter
* Erfarenhet av Jira, Confluence och Bitbucket

*Tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning – vilket innebär* ***krav på svenskt medborgarskap.***

**Upplysningar**


Anställningsform: Tillsvidare  

Arbetstider: Kontorstid (flextid)  

Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning.  

Placering: Norrköping eller Linköping


Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse

 **Ansökan**


Välkommen med dina ansökningshandlingar senast den **11 januari 2026.** Vi tar emot din ansökan via vårt rekryteringssystem.

  

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Om rekryteringsprocessen För oss är det viktigt att all kompetens på arbetsmarknaden tillvaratas. Vi välkomnar därför alla sökande och strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och mångfald. Som statlig myndighet rekryterar vi efter förtjänst och skicklighet. På arbetsgivarverket.se kan du läsa mer om vad det innebär. Vi använder urvalsfrågor under ansökningen. Besvara dem så utförligt du kan eftersom dina svar har betydelse för om du är kvalificerad att gå vidare i rekryteringen eller inte. I vissa rekryteringar använder vi också tester för att bedöma hur väl din skicklighet stämmer överens med tjänsten du söker. Vid en eventuell intervju kan du även få svara på frågor kopplat till säkerhet. Vill du komma i kontakt med fackliga företrädare finns kontaktuppgifter till Saco-S, Seko och ST längst ned på sidan ”Lediga jobb och intresseanmälan” på migrationsverket.se: Frågor och svar om att söka jobb på Migrationsverket För att arbeta på Migrationsverket behöver du ha rätt att vistas och arbeta i Sverige på någon av dessa grunder: svenskt medborgarskap (krav för vissa tjänster), nordiskt medborgarskap, EU-medborgarskap eller permanent uppehållstillstånd. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter, eller annan information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd, ska du kontakta rekrytering@migrationsverket.se innan du gör din ansökan så berättar vi mer om våra säkerhetsrutiner. Migrationsverkets behandling av personuppgifter Migrationsverkets rekryteringar sker helt i vår egen eller upphandlade leverantörers regi. Vi ber därför om att inte få telefonsamtal och mejl från rekryteringsföretag och annonsförsäljare.
