The Connectivity team plays a crucial role in ensuring secure and reliable communication between autonomous vehicles and cloud infrastructure. We are looking for a senior developer consultant who is enthusiastic about building robust connectivity platforms and enhancing the autonomous connectivity landscape.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Design and Develop our ATS Connectivity Solution: Develop and maintain a secure and reliable cloud-based or on-premise connectivity platform between offboard and onboard systems.
* Identity and Access Management: Manage identity and access control using certificates, ensuring each autonomous truck (AT) has a unique identity and access policies.
* Telemetry and Metrics: Implement telemetry metrics from AT to offboard (cloud platform), including connectivity status, latency, and vehicle metrics.
* Troubleshooting and Monitoring: Integrate logs and metrics into Grafana and Databricks dashboards to enable comprehensive service observability. Leverage automated runbooks to proactively mitigate downtime and accelerate root cause analysis during incidents .
* Robust security; Measures, including encryption, access controls, and regular security updates, to protect sensitive data and mitigate the risk of unauthorized access
* Bring-up: Develop tools for efficient deployment
* Over-the-Air (OTA) mechanisms: Implement bandwidth efficient mechanism for OTA transfer of large files
* Real-time Communication: Enable real-time updates and seamless communication between autonomous vehicles and cloud infrastructure.


**Education**
* Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or another related fields.
* 5+ years of proven work experience in the relevant area.


**Competence profile**
* Work Experience: 5+ years of proven work experience in relevant areas.
* Cloud Computing: Solid experience in AWS (Amazon Web Services) Cloud Computing Platform.
* Programming Languages: Proficiency in Kotlin. Experience in C++ is a bonus.
* Message Protocols: Solid experience working with gRPC. Experience with Kafka.
* Development Model: Familiarity with serverless architecture, Docker, and Kubernetes.
* Infrastructure as Code: Knowledge of Cloudformation
* Database Management: Experience with Dynamo DB
* Security: Robust understanding of encryption, access controls, and regular security updates.
* Agile Development: Experience working in an agile environment and participating in continuous deployment and testing.


**Meriting**
* Knowledge in other AI areas such as AI Planning, Generative AI, Knowledge Representation, Autonomous Robotics etc. is a plus.


**Other Information :**
**Start Date :** 
 2026-01-05
   

  

**End Date :** 
 2026-12-31
   

  

**Application Deadline** 
 : 2025-12-28
   

  

**Work Model :** 
 Hybrid
   

  

**Language:** 
 English
   

  

 Please apply directly through our system with:
   

  

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


 In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

title: System Specialist – Be the Link Between Tech and Business
description:
Kredinor is looking for a hands-on System Specialist to join our System Development team in Sweden. In this role, you will be essential in ensuring that our core systems run smoothly, evolve in the right direction, and effectively support our Swedish Operations and other key internal stakeholders.
 








**About Kredinor** 




 Kredinor began its establishment in Sweden in 2019 and has undergone an exciting growth journey in recent years. Kredinor Sweden is part of the Kredinor Group, Norway’s oldest debt collection company, which has been in operation since 1876. The group has over 600 employees and operates in Norway, Sweden, Finland, and Denmark. With a wide range of financial services, Kredinor handles 2.1 million cases annually for 4,300 clients.
 



 Kredinor Sweden is a growth company within debt collection, with strong ambitions to expand in selected segments through Nordic collaboration, innovation, and digitalization. Currently, we are about 35 employees working in bright and modern offices in Hammarby Sjöstad, just a 10-minute walk from Gullmarsplan.
 








**Main Responsibilities** 




 System Administration & Daily Support:
 



 - Act as the primary point of contact for system-related questions within Swedish Operations.
 



 - Handle daily system administration tasks to ensure stability and high availability.
 



 - Identify system issues, analyze root causes, resolve them, or escalate when needed.
 



 - Communicate system impacts, changes, and improvements to internal stakeholders.
 



  





 System Development & Continuous Improvement:
 



 - Test and validate new features, changes, and system upgrades.
 



 - Participate in system development initiatives together with the system provider and internal IT.
 



 - Improve system functionality, automation, and processes to support business needs.
 



 - Ensure the system maintains a high technical standard and aligns with strategic goals.
 



  





 Client Integrations & Projects:
 



 - Contribute to client onboarding and integration projects involving system configuration and testing.
 



 - Support smooth implementation of new clients into the system.
 



 - Collaborate with internal project teams and external system providers.
 



  





**Who are we looking for?** 




*Required Competencies:* 




 - Experience in system administration or system development.
 



 - Good understanding of technical integrations and system workflows.
 



 - Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
 



 - Strong communication skills and ability to support non-technical stakeholders.
 



 - Ability to collaborate closely with Swedish Operations and other internal teams.
 



  





*Highly Valued & Advantageous:* 




 - Experience with Aptic CLVR or a similar system, especially from an administrator or advanced user perspective.
 



 - Knowledge of debt collection processes in Sweden.
 



 - Experience working with Sales Ledger Services.
 



 - Project management experience or involvement in system-related projects.
 



  





 You thrive in a role where technology and business meet. You enjoy solving problems, helping others succeed, and continuously improving systems and processes. You are proactive, structured, and able to work independently while maintaining strong stakeholder collaboration.
 



 You thrive in constant change and are resilient to stress: you feel comfortable in a dynamic environment where conditions can change quickly. You are not stressed by unclear circumstances or continuous change.
 



  





**Why Join Kredinor?** 




 - Play a key role in supporting and developing systems for Swedish Operations.
 



 - Join a Nordic team on an exciting modernization journey.
 



 - Work in a supportive environment with room for growth and ownership.
 



 - Influence how systems evolve to meet operational and strategic needs.
 



  





 We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds and experiences.
 



  





 Recruitment process contains a telephone call (in Swedish), psychometric assessments, interviews (two different, in English). As part of the recruitment process, we conduct a background check on the final candidate.
 



  





 Application is open until mid-January, but the selection process is ongoing, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Data EngineerOm arbetsplatsen
   

  

 Är du en Data Engineer som vill vara del av något större? Hos oss får du arbeta i en verksamhet där tekniken aldrig står still, där du både kvalitetssäkrar data och vidareutvecklar plattformar som gör att våra användare får rätt stöd i rätt tid. Du får en nyckelroll i att hjälpa oss att använda data för att skapa ett tryggare, smartare och mer hållbart Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi är en viktig samhällsbyggare som levererar effektiva och hållbara vatten- och avfallstjänster – för dagens och framtida stockholmare. Varje dag, året runt, förser vi 1,6 miljoner stockholmare med rent och gott kranvatten, renar avloppsvatten och ser till att avfallet tas om hand. Tillsammans med invånare, företag och andra intressenter arbetar vi för att Stockholm ska bli världens mest hållbara stad.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som Data Engineer på Stockholm Vatten och Avfall får du en central roll i att både utveckla och förvalta våra affärs- och underhållssystem tillsammans med verksamheten, IT-partners och våra leverantörer. Du ser till att systemen är robusta, kostnadseffektiva och att de uppfyller lagkrav, interna policys och förväntningar från ledning och ägare.
   

  

 Du blir en viktig möjliggörare i hur vi använder data för att ta smartare beslut, effektivisera våra processer och bidra till bolagets hållbarhetsarbete. Genom att kvalitetssäkra data och utveckla stabila plattformar säkerställer du att användarna får rätt information och rätt stöd, i rätt tid och på rätt sätt. Du är en nyckelspelare i att omsätta stora datamängder till verklig nytta, från säkrare leveranser till mer hållbara investeringar.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med sex månaders provanställning med placering på huvudkontoret i Ulvsunda, Bromma.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

  

* Förvaltningsplanering enligt årshjul
* Användarsupport och behörighetsadministration
* Felsökning, incidenthantering och kommunikation vid avbrott
* Livscykelhantering och uppgraderingar
* Arbeta enligt säkerhetspolicy och informationssäkerhetskrav
* Kravställning i dialog med verksamhet och IT-partner


 Upprätthålla och vidareutveckla dokumentation av systemarkitektur och tekniska lösningar
   

 Kvalifikationer
   

 Vi söker dig som trivs i en roll där du får ta ansvar och driva ditt arbete framåt. När du stöter på utmaningar ser du lösningar istället för hinder och du tycker om att analysera dig fram till resultat som verkligen gör skillnad för verksamheten.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär många kontaktytor både internt och externt och därför är du bra på att skapa och vårda relationer. Du lyssnar in behov och kan översätta teknik till verksamhetsnytta samtidigt som du får andra att känna sig trygga i förändring.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Relevant högskoleexamen inom IT, systemvetenskap eller Civilingenjörsexamen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivare bedömer likvärdig
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av förvaltning och utveckling av datalager eller affärssystem
* Kunskaper inom SQL, SQL Server och informationsmodellering
* Förståelse för integrationer och dataflöden
* Erfarenhet av SAP BusinessObjects BI och Qlik Sense


 Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift
   

 Övrigt
   

 Låter det här som en spännande utmaning för dig? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-01-25 och bli en del av Stockholm Vatten och Avfalls framtid! På grund av ledigheter kommer rekryteringen att återupptas under vecka 4.
   

  

 För ytterligare information om tjänsten kontaktar du Enhetschef, Åsa Lindblom via mejl: Asa.Lindblom@svoa.se eller via telefon: 08-52212520 
   

  

 Våra fackliga representanter för Kommunal, Vision, Saco och Ledarna når du via Stockholm Vatten och Avfalls kundtjänst på telefon 08-522 120 00. 
   

  

 Eftersom vi strävar efter en trygg arbetsmiljö och har en samhällsviktig funktion genomför slutkandidater ett drogtest.
   

  

 Vi är en lärande organisation med mycket erfarenhet och kunskap som stöd för våra medarbetare. Vi erbjuder dig ett roligt och omväxlande jobb med intressanta arbetsuppgifter, duktiga kollegor och ett mycket bra arbetsklimat. Dessutom erbjuder vi goda anställningsvillkor, digitala och flexibla arbetssätt, kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling samt en rad hälsofrämjande fördelar. Läs mer om oss och träffa några av våra medarbetare på svoa.se/jobb
   

  

  Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

**Ansök senast**
 2026-01-25
   

**Anställningsform**
 Tillsvidareanställning
   

**Omfattning**
 HeltidKontakt
   

  

**Åsa Lindblom**
 Enhetschef
   

  

 Telefon: 0852212520

title: IT Secutirty and support technician
description:
*Vill du arbeta brett inom IT, kombinera teknisk support med säkerhetsarbete och vara en viktig del av vår dagliga IT‑drift? Nu söker vi en* 
***IT Security & Support Technician***
*som blir en viktig nyckelperson i vårt team.* 




  





  





**Om rollen** 




 I den här rollen får du en varierad vardag där du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt. Du kommer bland annat att:
 


* Tillsammans med en kollega ansvara för den interna dagliga IT‑driften och hantera 2nd line‑support
* Arbeta med installation och underhåll av datorer
* Hantera joiners & leavers och säkerställa att rätt accesser och utrustning finns på plats
* Administrera och köpa in mobiler, abonnemang, tangentbord, kablar och annan utrustning
* Vara
 **Data Protection Lea** 
 d – koordinera vid säkerhetsincidenter och arbeta förebyggande
* Ansvara för dokumentation och bidra i arbetet med ISO 27001



  





 Det här är en roll för dig som gillar att ha många kontaktytor, trivs med att lösa problem och vill bidra till en trygg och stabil IT‑miljö. Du får en bred roll med stort ansvar och möjlighet att utvecklas inom både IT‑drift och informationssäkerhet. Du blir en del av ett team där samarbete, kvalitet och långsiktighet står i centrum.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som trivs med att arbeta med människor och bidra med god service. Som person är du lugn, metodisk och noggrann. Du har en pedagogisk ådra och kan på ett enkelt vis förklara teknik för andra. Vi ser att du trivs i att arbeta i ett tight team där vi är prestigelösa, hjälper varandra och har roligt på jobbet. Vidare tror vi att du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av 2nd line‑support och liknande arbetsuppgifter
* Erfarenhet av klienthantering
* Flytande svenska och engelska
* B‑körkort
* Relevant utbildning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av nätverk
* Erfarenhet av ISO‑arbete är meriterande men inget krav



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Vi erbjuder dig goda utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter inom ett expansivt och lönsamt bolag. På Sharp är vi ett jordnära gäng och vi värdesätter gemenskap, uppriktighet och delaktighet.
 



  





 Våra värdeor
 *d – uppriktighet & kreativ* 
 itet – har följt med oss sedan 1912 och finns med i allt vi gör. För oss innebär det att vi är inkluderande, ställer upp för varandra, hittar nya vägar och ser möjligheter även i motgångar. Det är vi (alla medarbetare på Sharp) som är vår kultur, det är vi som tillsammans växer och det är vi som är varandras arbetsmiljö!
 



  





 För att vi ska kunna växa tillsammans utbildar vi såväl ledare som medarbetare inom olika områden. Som medarbetare på Sharp är du bland annat en de
 *l av Sharp Learning* 
 Forum där vi tillsammans utbildar varandra inom våra olika kompetensområden, allt för att skapa en högre kunskap och förståelse för varandras vardag!
 



  





**Om Sharp** 




 Sharp erbjuder lösningar för digitala arbetsplatser. Med vår gedigna erfarenhet, lokala förankring och breda kunskap levererar vi helhetslösningar för organisationer, oavsett bransch eller storlek. Det handlar om datorer, digitala möten och säker dokumenthantering till kompletta mötesrum, IT-drift, arbetsplatshantering och betallösningar. Vi säkerställer att företag alltid har rätt förutsättningar, utbildning och verktyg för att öka samarbete, kommunikation och säkerhet.

title: Business Analyst to Payments
description:
Would you like to help build Swedbank's next generation's payment platform?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Help test and maintain critical services and functionality within the super-hot payments area.
* Take part in the largest transformation of Swedbank’s payment infrastructure in decades.
* Analyse product requirements, technical impacts, system processes and solution designs.
* Write unit, functional and end-to-end tests, acceptance criteria, KPI's and test scenarios to measure the quality of our payment infrastructure.
* Take part in non-functional and performance testing to help scale up the environment for large transaction volumes.
* Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to communicate system status to Swedbanks management, suppliers and other stakeholders.
* Be part of a cross functional agile team in our Payments Agile Release Train that run the SAFe agile framework.
* Work closely and learn from domain experts in payments, architecture and mainframe systems.
* Develop yourself, contribute to the development of your team and the entire release train.
* Be part of a dynamic environment with cross functional teams that share challenges and build knowledge together


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Knowledge of methods and tools used in software testing.
* Experience working in Fintech, banking or familiar with financial process in large organizations
* Work experience from the payment domain is an advantage.
* Experience from ongoing initiatives such as ISO20022, Bank/plusgiro transformation, SEPA or similar is helpful.
* A team player with good collaboration and communication skills.
* Experience from agile ways of working, e.g. SAFe, scrum etc.
* Ability to communicate with IT and business stakeholders to reach a common understanding of the work that needs to be done.
* A driven, proactive, self-organized and an analytical approach with a strive to continuously improve.
* Proficient in English, spoken and written, Swedish is a plus.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 be part of the largest transformation of the payments area in decades. Learn a critical area for the bank and help building our new future infrastructure for payments. Work in an open atmosphere based on collaboration, curiosity and building knowledge.”
 **Sambath Kumar Shanmugam and Cecilia Snitth, your future managers**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 12.01.2026.
   

  

**Location: Stockholm, Sundbyberg**
**Recruiting manager: Sambath Kumar Shanmugam**
 We want to inform you that the recruitment process may be delayed due to Christmas holidays.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
**Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.**

title: Google Cloud Platform Engineer to SEB's Cloud Tribe | SEB, Solna
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Join SEB’s Cloud Tribe and help shape the future of scalable, secure, and innovative products by advancing Public Cloud technologies. Take on this exciting challenge and make a real impact!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a
 **Cloud Engineer** 
 within our Cloud Tribe, you will join a team of 25 highly engaged peers using new technology to develop and maintain services on top of Public Cloud Platforms catering for the platform’s technical Governance & Compliance. Work closely with operations, maintenance, and security of the platform. Our delivery includes guardrails, best practices, and supporting functionalities, all of which are paving the way for SEB’s developers to create a modern bank in the Clouds.
   

  

 As part of the Cloud Core Platforms, we offer a unique opportunity to be part of building the foundation of a paradigm change in banking. Being part of a multi-cloud tribe you will have the opportunity to gain skill and experience in multiple Public Cloud environments
 **.**
**To Thrive In This Position, We Believe You Have**
* Hands on experience with Google Cloud.
* Understanding other Cloud Platforms such as AWS and Azure.
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (such as Terraform), automation and CI/CD
* Experience with TypeScript, Bash and Python.
* Understanding of logging, monitoring and observability platforms.
* Knowledge of Agile principles
* Motivation and eagerness to learn


**What We Offer**
* We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Work-lifebalance.
* International opportunities and working environment.
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
* Innovative company in forefront of technology.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than
 **December the 31st, 2025.**
**Learn more about working at SEB: Technology | SEB**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

title: Kundservicemedarbetare
description:
**Kundservicemedarbetare till FireSeal AB** 




  





 Vill du ta nästa steg i din kundservicekarriär och arbeta i en roll där du inte bara hanterar ärenden – utan också äger, utvecklar och förbättrar ditt ansvarsområde? Trivs du i ett energifyllt team där vi stöttar varandra, har roligt på jobbet och gillar att hålla oss aktiva?
 
 Då kan detta vara rollen för dig.
 



 FireSeal AB är ett snabbväxande specialistföretag inom brandtätning och säkra lösningar för bygg-, fastighets- och marin sektor. Våra produkter används både på land och till sjöss, i Sverige och internationellt.
 



  





 Vi ingår i den börsnoterade koncernen Bergman & Beving, vilket ger oss stabilitet och långsiktighet – samtidigt som vi behåller ett entreprenöriellt arbetssätt där varje medarbetares bidrag är viktigt.
 



 Nu söker vi en erfaren kundservicemedarbetare som vill ta ansvar, arbeta strukturerat och bidra aktivt till att effektivisera och utveckla vårt kundservicearbete.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som kundservicemedarbetare hos oss har du en central roll i verksamheten. Du arbetar dagligen med:
 


* Kundkontakt via telefon och mejl, både nationellt och internationellt
* Ordermottagning och registrering i affärssystem
* Rådgivning kring produkter och lösningar
* Uppföljning av ärenden och problemlösning
* Eget ansvar för ditt område, med mandat att förbättra arbetssätt, rutiner och flöden
* Löpande arbete med effektivisering och kvalitetssäkring av kundprocesser



 Rollen är kontorsbaserad i Kista och du arbetar nära kollegor inom försäljning, marknad och övriga funktioner.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 



* Har erfarenhet av kundservice, orderhantering eller liknande roll
* Är mycket van vid IT-system och affärssystem och snabbt sätter dig in i nya verktyg
* Arbetar strukturerat, självständigt och tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter
* Trivs i en roll där du förväntas tänka förbättring, inte bara utföra
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift
* Är lösningsorienterad, prestigelös och trygg i kunddialoger



 Eftersom vi är ett mindre bolag är det viktigt att du är flexibel och trivs i en miljö där man ibland behöver hjälpa till där behov uppstår.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder:** 



* Marknadsmässig lön
* Kollektivavtal
* Förhöjt friskvårdsbidrag
* Gym och bastu i fastigheten
* Möjlighet till träning på lunchen
* Fri garageparkering
* Hälsoundersökning
* En arbetsplats med stark gemenskap och korta beslutsvägar
* Möjlighet att påverka, utvecklas och ta större ansvar över tid


- 


 Hos FireSeal värdesätter vi engagemang, ansvarstagande och viljan att utveckla både sig själv och arbetssätt. Här blir du sedd och får förtroende – men också förväntningar.
 



  





**Låter det här som rätt nästa steg för dig?** 




  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan. Bifoga CV och personligt brev.

title: GENERAL MANAGER FOR H&M BEAUTY
description:
**Job Description**

**GENERAL MANAGER FOR H&M BEAUTY**




**Shape the future of Beauty within one of the world’s most influential fashion destinations.**




 Do you want to play a pivotal role in elevating H&M’s Beauty business for the next era of growth? Are you a visionary leader who thrives in a fast-moving global environment, and who knows how to inspire teams to create irresistible customer experiences, sharp assortments and strong business results? If so, this might be your next opportunity.
   

  





**About H&M Beauty**




 H&M Beauty is an integrated part of H&M, created to complement and elevate the full fashion experience for our customers. Through a curated mix of private labels and external brands, we offer a dynamic and trend-driven beauty assortment spanning makeup, skincare, fragrance, haircare and beauty accessories. Our mission is to make beauty more inspiring, inclusive and accessible – empowering customers worldwide to express themselves and complete their fashion look.
   

  





 With a presence in 50
 
 markets and a rapidly evolving customer base, H&M Beauty is on an exciting journey. Here, you’ll join a creative, ambitious, and collaborative environment where innovation and customer obsession shape every decision.
   

  





**Job Description**




**WHAT YOU’LL DO** 






**We are now looking for a** 
**General Manager for H&M Beauty** 
 who will lead the continued development of our global Beauty offering and inspire a strong team to deliver on our ambitious vision. In this role, you will drive the evolution and growth of the business, shaping strategies that strengthen customer relevance, sales and profitability across all channels and markets, both short and long term. You will also hold responsibility for creating and optimizing a compelling customer offer, including private label and external brands, and for ensuring that Beauty’s role within H&M delivers both commercial value and a best-in-class customer experience.
   

  





**Responsibilities:**



* **Lead the global Beauty agenda** 
 Drive the overall business strategy, performance, creative direction and operational excellence that enable the Beauty business within H&M. Develop and secure an inspiring, fashion-connected customer offer and experience that boosts sales and profitability across all channels and markets.
* **Build and empower a high-performing team** 
 : Create a fast-moving, collaborative, inclusive and learning-oriented organization. Inspire teams to combine strategic thinking with hands-on execution, fostering an environment where people are autonomous, motivated, and energized by our growth journey.
* **Be a culture carrier** 
 : Lead by example and embody H&M’s values and leadership expectations in everything you do. Demonstrate curiosity, collaboration, accountability, and a willingness to challenge and improve.
* **Bring energy and positivity** 
 : Have fun, enjoy the journey and inspire others to do the same — this is a role where passion, creativity and momentum truly make a difference.



**WHO YOU ARE** 
  

  





**Experience and Knowledge:**




 You are a self-driven leader with a global mindset and a genuine passion for beauty, brands, and business growth. You combine strong vision and strategic clarity with the ability to build teams that execute with speed, simplicity, and impact. Your communication is inspiring and straightforward, and you thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment. You are always looking for smarter, more customer-centric ways of working, and you see the full business picture.
   

  





**In addition to matching the personal profile, we also seek the following qualifications:**



* an academic degree in a relevant field
* extensive experience and a true passion for the Beauty industry
* extensive experience from building, leading, and growing multinational businesses – developing markets and new business segments
* Strong stakeholder management skills create outcomes through relationships both internal and external.
* Strong negotiation skills and the ability to build business partnerships with external partners.
* a solid commercial focus – sales-driven with a curious mindset, always focused on the best and most cost-efficient solution
* excellent communication and presentation skills including written and verbal skills in English



 At H&M, our values are at the heart of everything we do and one of the reasons we are a global leader in fashion. We believe in people and in winning as a team. We are ambitious yet humble, entrepreneurial, open-minded, cost-conscious and committed to always improving.
   

  





 We are looking for a leader who not only embraces these values but actively lives them — someone who will represent our culture, challenge us to grow and help shape the future of Beauty within H&M.
   

  





***Our People***




*Our most important strengths and asset is our engaged colleagues and our unique company culture. Attracting and developing world-class talent is central to H&M Group’s vision.* 
  

  





*At H&M Group, colleagues are trusted with great responsibility right from the start. We focus on building outstanding leadership that encourages creativity, care, and strong business outcomes by putting trust in people to reach the full potential of our colleagues. This approach ensures that our teams are empowered to drive our purpose forward.* 
  

  





*H&M Group’s team of around 135,000 colleagues from more than 170 nationalities brings a rich mix of cultures and perspectives. Guided by our values, we create a passionate and creative company culture where everyone can grow and contribute to our goals. We strive to have diverse teams and an inclusive environment where everyone can be themselves. This supports creativity in making relevant customer offers and contributes to more inclusive products and marketing.* 
  

  





**Additional Information** 
  

  





 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Please apply by submitting your CV in English as soon as possible,
 **no later than 19 of dec** 
 . We will review and interview candidates ongoing. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page.
   

  





 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  





**JOIN US** 
  

  





 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things, our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  





 We are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Inside Sales Associate
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 Are you interested in building a career in sales? Do you love talking to new people and see yourself as a true hunter? Do you enjoy working in a fast-paced and competitive environment? Then we’d like to chat!
   

  

 Wolt is a technology company best known for our food delivery platform. To customers on our platform, we now also offer a wide range of other options from groceries to pet food. Today, we serve customers, create new revenue streams for merchants and offer earning for courier partners opportunity across 23 countries and more than 350 cities. In 2022, we joined forces with DoorDash to supercharge our mission to make cities a better place to live in - and we’re only getting started!
   

  

 We are growing our business in Sweden and are looking for a
 **Sales Associate** 
 .
   

  

 This role focuses on retaining existing partners, driving revenue through promotions and advertising, and improving partner performance at scale
   

  

 You will work primarily via phone, email, and digital tools, using data and structured outreach to identify upsell opportunities, reduce churn, and ensure partners get the most value out of Wolt.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 Day-to-day you will own and manage a large portfolio of
 **mass-managed restaurant and retail partners** 
 on Wolt in Sweden. Additionally, you might help our Account Management teams with their book of business. Previous experience in marketing and sales is preferred, but most important is your motivation and interest to learn sales!
   

  

**Day-to-day in this role you’ll:**
* Manage a large portfolio of mass-managed restaurant and retail partners
* Proactively prevent churn by identifying risk signals and engaging partners early
* Negotiate commercial terms and conditions, and collect documentation
* Sell and upsell promotions, campaigns, and advertising products to drive partner growth
* Run outbound sales and retention campaigns via phone, email, and in-product tools
* Educate partners on best practices to improve visibility, conversion, and sales on Wolt
* Use data to segment partners, prioritize outreach, and tailor recommendations
* Meet or exceed monthly revenue, retention, and activity targets
* Collaborate with Account Management, Sales, Marketing, Partner Support, and Ops to improve partner experience at scale
* Gather partner feedback and surface insights to internal teams


**Our humble expectations**
* 1–3+ years of experience in inside sales, account management, or customer success
* You are motivated by talking to new people every day, and consider yourself as a “Hunter”
* You love to compete and thrive in a result-driven environment where we celebrate success
* You have a can-do attitude and are ready to roll up the sleeves and get to work in a fast-paced startup environment
* You are a strong communicator and have fundamental commercial understanding
* You are fluent in Swedish and English in speaking and writing


**What We Offer**
 At Wolt, we believe great people thrive when given ownership, trust, and the chance to make an impact. As a Sales Associate, you’ll get just that – along with a competitive salary and the opportunity to grow in a fast-moving global tech company with plenty of career paths.
   

  

**Next steps**
 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Junior cybersäkerhetstekniker
description:
*Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? Vi söker en juniortekniker med stort tekniskt intresse och förmåga att hålla många bollar i luften. På FRA är varje arbetsuppgift en del av något större. Är du den vi söker kan vi erbjuda ett varierande arbete i en kunskapsintensiv miljö där du får vara med och göra skillnad varje dag.*
**Ditt uppdrag**
 Som junior tekniker är du placerad på avdelningen för cyberverksamhet, kontoret för Accessutveckling (AU). Du kommer att bidra till att stärka skyddet mot kvalificerade IT-angrepp från utlandet hos samhällsviktig verksamhet i Sverige samt att utveckla och leverera access- och exploateringsförmåga till signalunderrättelseverksamheten.
   

  

 I rollen som junior tekniker blir du en viktig del i drift‑ och utveckling. Du arbetar i en dynamisk miljö där varje dag innebär nya utmaningar och möjligheter att göra skillnad.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är att driva, övervaka och vidareutveckla driften i ett av AU-kontorets system. Vid intresse och förmåga så finns det möjlighet att vidareutvecklas inom rollen och på kontoret.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Säkerställa drift av ett system
* Analysera resultat, identifiera avvikelser och föreslå förbättringar
* Dokumentera processer och ge stöd till interna användare och intressenter.
* Delta i driftstöd och, vid behov, arbete på skift.
* Bidra med idéer och förbättringsförslag för att löpande stärka vår tekniska förmåga.


**Du kan**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Gymnasieexamen
* Erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter
* God datavana
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Vi Ser Det Som Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Eftergymnasialutbildning, typ högskoleingenjör eller yrkesutbildning
* Erfarenhet från helpdesk/SOC
* Kunskap inom Bash‑ eller Python‑skriptning


**Du är**
 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som trivs med att samarbeta med andra. Du har ett tekniskt intresse. Vi ser att du som kommer trivas i den här rollen är initiativrik och föreslår gärna egna förbättringar samt tar gärna fram nya lösningar. Vi ser att du som träder in i rollen har förmågan att arbeta strukturerat och fokuserat i ett återkommande arbetsflöde.
   

  

 Det är en utvecklande roll som kommer att kombineras med övriga arbetsuppgifter tillsammans med andra kunniga kollegor inom Cyber. För dig som har intresse och engagemang finns möjligheter att utvecklas inom kontoret.
   

  

**Om FRA**
 FRA har omvärlden som sin arena där varje arbetsuppgift är en del av något större. På ett eller annat sätt får du som medarbetare vara med och bidra till att skydda Sveriges integritet och oberoende i världen. Du är med och gör skillnad på riktigt, varje dag.
   

  

 Vår uppgift som underrättelsetjänst är att skydda Sverige mot de allvarligaste hot som kan riktas mot ett samhälle – militära angrepp, terrorism och cyberattacker. Vi skyddar det viktigaste vi har – vår trygghet, vår demokrati och vårt sätt att leva. Vi är experter på cyberområdet och signalspaning samt en larmklocka för militära hot.
   

  

 FRA leder sedan 2024 Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter, NCSC vars uppdrag är att utveckla och stärka Sveriges förmåga att förebygga, upptäcka och hantera cyberhot.
   

  

 Som nyanställd på FRA får du en omfattande introduktionsutbildning och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, vilket ger dig möjlighet att utveckla dina färdigheter och bli ännu bättre på det du brinner för. Vår organisation är mångfacetterad och består av olika kompetenser och personligheter, där varje individ har unika egenskaper och förutsättningar. Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla känner sig välkomna och trygga. Utöver en stimulerande arbetsmiljö erbjuder vi också ett attraktivt förmånspaket, som du kan läsa mer om på www.fra.se . För mer information om Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter besök www.ncsc.se
   

  

 För din trygghet. För vår demokrati. Varje dag. Året om.
   

  

**Mer information**
 Arbetsplatsen är belägen i närheten av Drottningholm, ca 10 min från Brommaplan. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då anställning vid FRA innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för att få anställning är godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprövningen kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef på nummer
 **010-557 51 11.** 
 Fackliga företrädare nås på
 **010-557 46 00** 
 .
   

  

 Vi tar emot ansökningar via www.fra.se
 **senast 2026-01-11.**
 Referensnummer
 **2025FRA2299-2** 
 .
   

  

 Då vi inför denna rekrytering redan tagit ställning till de rekryteringskanaler vi önskar använda undanber vi oss att bli kontaktade för ytterligare erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.
   

  

**Sökord**
*Helpdesk, cybersäkerhet, SOC, systemutveckling, mobilteknik, telekommunikation*

title: Operations Solutions Lead
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
 The Role
   

  

 As our Operations Solutions Lead, you will architect and operationalise the AI-enabled infrastructure that powers Legora’s global scale. You will design and build the systems, automations, and processes that ensure we operate with precision, speed, and minimal overhead — creating an operational foundation that is robust, auditable, and built to scale seamlessly.
   

  

**Your mandate is simple:** 
 Build the most automated, AI-powered, operationally excellent organisation — empower our staff to do more with less.
   

  

 You will partner across Product, Engineering, GTM, and Legal to translate organisational complexity into elegant, scalable architectures and ensure that meaningful leverage comes from technology not people.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

 Cross-Functional Operational Leadership
   

  

* Collaborate closely with leaders, operational heads (IT, Revenue Operations, Product Operations, Chief of Staffs) and the business to ensure systems and processes align with priorities and scale efficiently.
* Translate ambiguous operational needs into structured requirements, implementation roadmaps, and success metrics.
* Establish operational rigor across initiatives, enabling predictability, repeatability, and high-quality execution.
* Lead mission-critical projects end-to-end, balancing strategy with hands-on ownership.
* Champion operational simplicity and discipline across the organisation, ensuring teams operate with clarity and leverage.
* Serve as a key driver of operational simplicity, discipline, and efficiency across teams.


 AI-Enabled Systems & Software Implementation
   

  

* Own and evolve the firm-wide operational tools that enable efficiency and scale.
* Design systems that are automation-first and built for accuracy, resilience, compliance, and data integrity.
* Implement robust governance, documentation, and lifecycle practices to ensure continuity and sustainable adoption.
* Ensure tooling contributes to visibility, decision clarity, and measurable business impact.


 Integrations, Automation & Workflow Orchestration
   

  

* Build and maintain the integrations that connect our operational stack end-to-end.
* Identify bottlenecks, friction points, and manual workflows — and replace them with automated, AI-driven operations.
* Partner with the organisation to design resilient, scalable workflows that support rapid growth and global operations.


 Process Design for a Lean, AI-First Organisation
   

  

* Map, design, and optimise processes for speed, accuracy, and near-zero manual intervention.
* Build workflows that self-diagnose through metrics, automated triggers, and monitoring frameworks.
* Establish a data driven culture driven by dashboards, reporting structures, and KPI frameworks that enable decision-making discipline.
* Ensure processes are robust, consistent, and capable of withstanding external evaluation.


 Who You Are
   

  

 You are deeply motivated by efficiency, leverage, and simplicity. You want to build an organisation where AI, automation, and great systems do the heavy lifting — not large teams, layers, or bureaucracy.
   

  

 You thrive in ambiguity, bring structure to chaos, and naturally turn messy workflows into elegant systems. You are hands-on, analytical, and operationally rigorous, with a bias for automation over coordination and tooling over headcount.
   

  

**Most Importantly**
 You believe the future belongs to organisations that stay exceptionally lean — and you want to build one.
   

  

 What We’re Looking For
   

  

* 7-12+ years in operations, project management, systems management, solutions engineering, or process design in high-growth environments.
* Proven experience implementing software, building integrations, and automating workflows at scale using modern tooling and event-driven patterns.
* Strong technical fluency with the ability to design, deploy, and maintain event-based architectures in the cloud.
* Analytical, structured, and detail-oriented — with a deep love for simplification.
* Exceptional communication skills; able to align technical and non-technical stakeholders around outcomes.
* Comfortable with fast-moving priorities and owning outcomes in a dynamic environment.
* Experience with operational controls, quality standards, data governance, and building systems that withstand external review.


 Why This Role Matters
   

  

 This is a foundational role. The systems and processes you build will determine how we scale — not by adding people, but by adding capability. You will help create an organisation where AI is embedded in every workflow, where operations run with speed and precision, and where a small, exceptional team can achieve what typically takes hundreds.
   

  

 If we succeed, it will be because we built one of the most automated, AI-native operational engines in the world — and you will have been the architect behind it.
   

  

**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Solution Architect (Post Sales)
description:
Stockholm, Sweden/ Copenhagen, Denmark
   

  

**Puzzel: The Low-Down** 
**🔍**
 Puzzel is a leading provider of cloud-based contact centre solutions, empowering businesses to deliver exceptional customer service. Our platform combines omnichannel contact centre, workforce management, and AI-driven analytics to optimize customer interactions and operational efficiency.
   

  

 With 25 years’ experience since our foundation in Norway, we’re already #1 in the Nordics, growing rapidly in the UK and expanding into the Netherlands and Finland in 2024, but our ambition is to become the clear European market-leader in the coming years 🚀
   

  

**Why we’re proud**
* 2024 CX Awards Winner, ‘Best Mid-Market Contact Center Platform’
* Puzzel was recognised as the 'most innovative European-founded CCaaS provider' and top 3 globally by Frost & Sullivan in 2023
* Best Practices Company of the Year 2023
* Consistently high Glassdoor rating
* 2023 customer NPS score of 37
* Puzzel places high importance on work-life balance and flexible working hours - as recognised by Flexa, placing 16th overall for work:life balance in 2025!
* We are working with Mercer on salary benchmarking, to ensure pay equality and market competitiveness


**Key Data Points**
* €57m revenue in FY 2024 (up from €50m in 2023)
* Currently ~300 employees
* Used by more than 1100 businesses across 40 countries
* Servicing ~60,000 customer service agents on a daily basis + 800 million customer interactions yearly


**What we’re looking for** 
**🔎**
 We are looking for a highly skilled Solution Architect with proven technical and post-sales expertise in a solution-based B2B tech market, ideally within the contact centre or a related vertical.
   

  

 This is an additional headcount due to growth with some big deliveries in play at the moment, so it is a busy, but exciting time to be joining Puzzel.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will be customer-facing, capable of presenting complex technical solutions with confidence, bridging the gap between technology and business benefits, managing customer expectations, and establishing technical credibility.
   

  

**What you'll do** 
**🏡💻**
* Solution Design and Documentation: Create well-structured and detailed technical design documents.
* Consultancy: Provide consultancy on industry best practices.
* Technical Authority: Act as a technical authority on customer projects and change processes.
* Subject Matter Expert (SME): Operate as a Subject Matter Expert.
* Optimization Programs: Run optimization programs to ensure customers get the best value from their investment.
* Workshops: Lead workshops to deeply understand customers’ needs.
* Customer Engagement: Engage proactively with customers to ensure high-quality and timely delivery.
* Brand Representation: Represent the company and brand positively in the marketplace.
* Project Time Recording: Accurately record project time spent.
* Team Support: Assist and coach junior team members.
* Knowledge Sharing: Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions within the team.


**The must haves** 
**💪**
* Experience: Professional experience in Contact Centre, Customer Experience, Telecom, Cloud Technologies, or programming/integrations.
* Technical Knowledge: Experience with Enterprise Voice, Contact Centre, or Unified Communications. Knowledge of basic telephony (SIP/VoIP) routing and technologies such as IVR, CTI, Speech Recognition, and CRM.
* Competencies: Clear communication around technical terminology + strong presentation skills. You should be systematic and process-driven.


**The nice to haves** 
**➕➕➕**
* Degree in technically related field


**The location**
 This role can be located in the Stockholm or Copenhagen office, with expectation of 2-3 days/week in the office.
   

  

**What’s In it for You?** 
**💰**
* Competitive, fixed salary
* Flexible, hybrid approach to working; split your time between the office and home
* You get to be part of a fun, driven and supportive team
* Gift on your birthday
* Annual Summer and Christmas parties
* Excellent development opportunities and a great company culture


**What to expect from the interview process** 
**❔**
* Screening call with Talent Acquisition
* 1st interview with Solution Architect Manager
* Case study/presentation to Solution Architect Manager, Manager Implementation and VP Professional Services
* Final interview with Chief Customer Officer and Solution Architect Manager


**Puzzel Values** 
**🎯**
* Built on Trust – trust is an intrinsic Nordic value, upon which Puzzel has been built. We trust each other and our customers and partners trust us.
* Stronger Together – working together in a genuinely collaborative way, with a shared purpose, we have an empowered organisation that is better equipped to delight customers and partners.
* Stay Hungry – have a continuous hunger to raise our game, innovate and be the best we can be professionally.


**Diversity & Inclusion** 
**🌍**
 We want everyone at Puzzel to be their true, authentic selves at work irrespective of nationality, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical ability, age, or economic background.
   

  

 Whilst we are proud to already have a diverse workforce from across the globe, we are aware that things could always be improved – for example, we currently have a ratio of female 26:74 male employees, which whilst not uncommon for the tech industry (average in SaaS is 26% female), it’s far from ideal. So, what are we doing to improve this?
   

  

* Our Global Leadership Team (C-suite) has shifted from 100% male to 50 male: 50 female in the past 18 months.
* We have increased our % of female hires from 23.6% in 2021 to 38.5% in 2023.
* We are partnering with the likes of Flexa, who have significantly higher-than-average talent pools of candidates from diverse backgrounds.
* We are working with State Employment initiatives in Norway and Sweden to bring candidates through internship/apprenticeship routes and are investigating similar initiatives in the UK and Bulgaria.
* By raising awareness and transparency, we are hoping to further attract a diverse workforce.


 We are continuously striving to foster an inclusive and diverse environment, where everyone is celebrated for who they are. If there is anything we can do to support you in the interview process, or beyond, please let us know.
   

  

**One Last Thing** 
**☝** 
**🏻**
 Even if you feel you are only a 75% match for this role, we still want to hear from you. This list is purely indicative. Skills can always be learnt.
   

  

 Please note that we are not able to provide sponsorship for this role, so you must have eligibility to work in the country you are applying for.
   

  

*By applying you accept the terms of our Privacy Notice which can be found on our website. Puzzel are not considering candidates that do not have a work permit in the country we are hiring in.*

title: IT Architect (Distribution Business)
description:
Vattenfall is recognized as one of the first movers in the energy transition – and by that power climate smarter living for all our customers.
   

  

 Yet, our investment power, innovation, and ambitious change agenda to become fossil free in one generation, can only be met if the Swedish grid is ready to deal with this electrification revolution. To face this challenge we invest in our people and we continue to employ exceptional IT talent. With our team, we are advancing the Distribution business area in Vattenfall as a data driven company allowing them to optimize decision making and investment planning.
   

  

**This Means We Are Architecting**
* Full IT/OT convergence to ensure frictionless transfer of data (near) real time
* Advanced solutions to deliver real-time insights into the performance of our grid, substations, transmission lines to lower maintenance costs
* IT infrastructure and solutions that are hyper-scalable and reliable to meet Distribution reliability and growth target
* Seamless and secure market communication and open data sharing to support Europe’s vision for an interconnected grid.
* Strategic solutions/landscapes to meet Distribution’s Strategic Targets (Distribute twice the amount of electricity, and distribute with 99.99% continuity)


 Our team requires true Business facing Solution architects; You know how to use technology to make Distribution run as
 *clockwork* 
 , you act as
 *timer* 
 to ensure we meet our ambitious goals and be an
 *alarm* 
 if we can do better! We have a large SAP and Microsoft footprint, with more than 20.000 users in six countries
   

  

 Our Group IT Architecture team of 30 enterprise / solution architects is involved in around 100+ key projects at any time, focusing on enterprise architecture and solution architecture for all Vattenfall business units. We act as the hub to understand business needs and to see the bigger Vattenfall picture to help our teams securely adopt the technologies of tomorrow.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* You will join the larger strategic projects, to guide them into successful execution based on fit-for-purpose architecture
* You will consult and educate the Distribution business on IT strategy, integration strategy, data strategy etc
* You have a solid understanding of IT security and will support Distribution in fit-for-purpose adoption.
* You will have (or build up) Distribution domain knowledge to become the go-to point how Distribution should advance its IT landscape.
* You will, in dialogue with business, drive a further adoption of data mesh
* You will help us grow our Enterprise thinking and establish standards and architecture principles. You will be our trusted advisor towards our Distribution and other business area’s to enable their operating model by technology – also if that is that means radical change!


**Qualifications**
 We are looking for a seasoned Architect, with experience preferably as architect or consultant in water or energy utilities, manufacturing, or automotive.
   

  

 You Feel Comfortable Communicating With Both IT And Non-IT Colleagues On Different Levels In The Organization. You Enjoy Being In An Ever-changing Environment. Furthermore You
   

  

* Have an academic degree in IT or related study
* Have worked in an international environment and you speak Swedish and English
* Have deep IT knowledge and experience with IT architecture and frameworks
* Ideally bring experience from an asset intensive industry – and you understand security considerations, IEC 62443, ISO27001 etc.
* Have experience with Microsoft Azure Well Architected Framework
* You enjoy producing enterprise ready architecture documents
* And you have the skills to direct complex problems into concise Management Board action
* And… we love architects who talk business and know TOGAF, rather than those that talk TOGAF and know business …


**Location:** 
 for this position you will be based in Sweden, with some travelling to the office (Stockholm, Solna). Occasionally also travel to Distribution locations, like Trollhattan or Amsterdam and Berlin for team events. Travel will be approximately once month for two days.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

**Our Offer**
* Become part of a massive transformative purpose – not on paper, but in real-life – whereby you can influence the outcome!
* We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field.
* You will work in an interdisciplinary team with other senior IT Architects – so we do this together!
* A professional environment where your experience, knowledge and attitude will bring us one step further and the opportunity for you to grow further.
* A central office location with easy access by public transport.
* Furthermore, a healthy work-life balance (smart working) and time to develop your profession
* At Vattenfall you get the opportunity to work for a clean energy company that aims for creating fossil free energy within one generation.
* And last but not least; International and multi-cultural work environment with energetic, motivated colleagues that like to have fun as well!


**More information**
 We welcome your application in English, including CV and cover letter via our website. For information about the position, please contact recruiting manager Emile Das, +31 6 5250 4359. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact Recruiter Folmer Koper +31 6 38710915.
   

  

 At Vattenfall, we are convinced that striving for diversity helps building a more profitable, efficient and attractive company. We continue to seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of gender, age, ethnic and cultural backgrounds.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible within one generation and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.

title: Field Service Engineer 2 - Sweden
description:
What if the work you did every day could impact the lives of people you know? Or all of humanity?
   

  

 At Illumina, we are expanding access to genomic technology to realize health equity for billions of people around the world. Our efforts enable life-changing discoveries that are transforming human health through the early detection and diagnosis of diseases and new treatment options for patients.
   

  

 Working at Illumina means being part of something bigger than yourself. Every person, in every role, has the opportunity to make a difference. Surrounded by extraordinary people, inspiring leaders, and world changing projects, you will do more and become more than you ever thought possible.
   

  

**Field Service Engineer 2, Sweden (Remote/Field Based) 1-Year FTC**
**Closing date - Thursday 1st January 2026**
 As a
 **Field Service Engineer (FSE) at Illumina** 
 you are responsible for providing the on-site service of Illumina equipment at our customer sites, this includes installations, as well as overseeing any necessary troubleshooting, servicing and repairs of complex equipment and systems. You will be working closely with customers within your territory, providing a dedicated service as well as liaising with your colleagues to provide timely onsite technical assistance.
   

  

**Illumina customers are at the forefront of genetics and NGS (Next Generation Sequencing)** 
 , helping to deliver advancements in life sciences, oncology, reproductive health, agriculture and other emerging markets.
   

  

 This is a
 **fixed term contract** 
 position for 12 months to be based in
 **Sweden,** 
 the suitable candidate would preferably be based in the
 **Uppsala** 
 area, or we could
 **also consider applicants based in Stockholm, Gothenburg and Malmo.** 
 It is
 **essential for the role to have a valid** 
****d** 
 riving license** 
 within country and the the flexibility to
 **travel up to 80%. Fluent English language skills are essential along with Swedish language.**
***Illumina's employee benefits are industry-leading and include, flexible time off, private medical insurance, compassion and care time off, leisure travel insurance, pension, employee stock purchasing program, volunteer time off, and much more!***
**Responsibilities Will Include**
* Interface between the field organization and internal support structure by providing timely onsite technical assistance to Customers, Field Applications Scientist/Specialists, and Territory Account Managers
* Serve as a focal point for problem resolution assistance to subsidiary or distributor support
* Install, upgrade, repair, and maintain instrument systems within defined territory
* Provide technical support to staff, contractors and customers
* Special assignments and administrative duties as directed by Field Service Manager or designate
* Respond to service requests and ensure high levels of customer satisfaction
* Routinely complete administrative work, such as but not limited to: Time Reports, Expense Reports, Equipment Site Assessments, Inventory Reports, Internal Laboratory Reports, Equipment Checklists, RMA Forms and Service Reports
* Manage service parts inventory levels
* Maintain up to date customer information, technical files and appropriate databases
* Work in conjunction with other staff to coordinate new system placements, develop leads, promote upgrades and contract renewals etc.
* Maintain routine contact with existing customer base
* Ability to drive and travel around Scotland, UK & Ireland, mainly Scotland as a key focus.


**Role Requirements**
* Some relevant, field based engineering experience
* Previous experience in the biotechnology/biomedical industry, or applicable military experience preferred
* Demonstrable strong problem-solving skills
* Excellent customer facing skills along with good technical abilities
* Ability to work autonomously within a structured, remote team
* Familiarity with field optical alignments, robotics, fluidics, electrical/electronics, and mechanical systems is advantageous
* Previous experience within a fast-paced corporate environment is desirable
* Valid in country driving license with the willingness to travel up to 80%
* Fluent English language skills as well as fluent Swedish language
* Qualification in Electrical / Electronic Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Biosciences or similar


 We are a company deeply rooted in belonging, promoting an inclusive environment where employees feel valued and empowered to contribute to our mission. Built on a strong foundation, Illumina has always prioritized openness, collaboration, and seeking alternative perspectives to propel innovation in genomics. We are proud to confirm a zero-net gap in pay, regardless of gender, ethnicity, or race. We also have several Employee Resource Groups (ERG) that deliver career development experiences, increase cultural awareness, and offer opportunities to engage in social responsibility. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information. Illumina conducts background checks on applicants for whom a conditional offer of employment has been made. Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with applicable local, state, and federal laws. Background check results may potentially result in the withdrawal of a conditional offer of employment. The background check process and any decisions made as a result shall be made in accordance with all applicable local, state, and federal laws. Illumina prohibits the use of generative artificial intelligence (AI) in the application and interview process. If you require accommodation to complete the application or interview process, please contact accommodations@illumina.com. To learn more, visit: https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf. The position will be posted until a final candidate is selected or the requisition has a sufficient number of qualified applicants. This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

title: IT Compliance Specialist
description:
Är du en engagerad IT Compliance Specialist som vill visa vägen för en säker och hållbar digital framtid??
 



  





**Vill du omsätta regelverk till fungerande lösningar i vardagen? Som IT Compliance Specialist hos oss arbetar du operativt i IT-organisationen och ser till att kontroller, rutiner och rapportering fungerar – i nära samarbete med drift, säkerhet och utveckling.** 




  





 Försäkringar och hälsa är en vinnande kombination! Genom tidiga insatser, samarbete med kompetenta partners och smarta digitala tjänster har vi på Euro Accident fått saker att hända. Med vårt erbjudande har försäkring gått från att bara vara ekonomisk ersättning till att bidra till livskvalitet och Hållbara medarbetare. Idag har nästan en halv miljon människor trygghet genom oss. Vi är stolta över våra nöjda kunder, vårt goda rykte och den insats vi gör för samhället. Nu avancerar vi för att kunna hjälpa ännu fler och söker dig som vill vara med på vår fortsatta framgångsresa.
 



  





 Om rollen
 



  





 IT Compliance Specialist är en helt ny roll hos oss och här får du arbeta operativt inom IT-avdelningen med fokus på att säkerställa att organisationen uppfyller regulatoriska krav, bland annat enligt DORA (Digital Operational Resilience Act). Rollen har ett praktiskt genomförandefokus. Du etablerar, förbättrar och integrerar IT-kontroller i processer och verktyg samt följer upp att de efterlevs. Du samarbetar tätt med CISO, risk och compliance och tar ansvar inför interna och externa revisioner.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter:** 




  




* Bygga, dokumentera och vidareutveckla IT-kontroller (t.ex. accesshantering, backup/återläsningstest, change management), inklusive möjlig automatisering.
* Genomföra kontroller och testcykler; samla bevis, följa upp avvikelser och driva åtgärder till stängning.
* Omsätta DORA och GDPR till praktiska rutiner och stödja införande i system och arbetsflöden.
* Du ansvarar för att planera, genomföra och följa upp interna och externa IT-revisioner, samordna med revisorer, dokumentera och implementera åtgärder.
* Stötta införande av AIlösningar i linje med DORA/AI Act – policy, datarutiner, loggning och riskbedömning.
* Bidra till ökad medvetenhet genom workshops, checklistor och mallar.



  





 Vem är du?
 



  





 Vi söker dig som har några års erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-compliance, IT-revision eller internkontroll, och en vilja att arbeta nära verksamheten med praktiskt genomförande.
 



  





**Vi ser även att du:** 




  




* Har praktisk erfarenhet av DORA, GDPR, NIS2 eller liknande ramverk och förmåga att omsätta dem till fungerande rutiner.
* Har kunskap om cybersäkerhet, incidenthantering och relevanta ramverk (t.ex. CIS Controls).
* Behärskar svenska flytande och har mycket goda kunskaper i engelska, i tal och skrift.



  





**Det är meriterande om du dessutom har:** 




  




* Bakgrund som IT-revisor som trivs med att implementera.
* Erfarenhet från finans eller annan reglerad bransch.
* Erfarenhet av automatiserade kontroller/rapporteringsverktyg.



  





 Som person förmedlar du budskap effektivt och har en förmåga att hantera komplex information och dra slutsatser utifrån det. Du trivs med att arbeta strukturerat och motiveras av att samarbeta tillsammans med andra . Du delar självklart våra värderingar: omtanke, handlingskraft och nytänkade- vår kompass i vardagen.
 



  





 På Euro Accident är det vi medarbetare som bygger framgång. Personliga egenskaper och förmågor är alltid en viktig komponent när vi söker nya medarbetare.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder dig
 



  





 När vi bidrar till en trygg och frisk värld börjar vi på våra egna kontor. Vi vill att du ska få och välja en sund balans mellan arbete och privatliv och vi värnar om arbetsglädjen och vår unika kultur där omtanke, handlingskraft och nytänkande är våra ledord i vardagen. Vi erbjuder förmånlig tjänstepension, sjuk- och sjukvårdsförsäkring samt ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet till hybridarbete. Med vår EA-spirit håller vi kulturen och gemenskapen levande genom olika sociala aktiviteter, som gemensamma frukostar, afterworks och föreläsningar med tema hälsa och välmående.
 



  





 Du välkomnas till vårt trivsamma kontor vid Mörby C. Start enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan
 



  





 Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig chef Emil Berntling enligt kontaktuppgifterna nedan. Vi är på julledighet och ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan samt besvara eventuella frågor när vi är tillbaka efter 7e januari. Efter detta sker urval löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan.
 



  





 För en mer rättvis och objektiv urvalsprocess använder vi arbetspsykologiska tester tidigt i processen och ber dig att svara på våra urvalsfrågor i stället för att bifoga ett personligt brev.
 



  





 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomför vi bakgrundskontroller av våra slutkandidater före anställningsbeslut.
 



  





*Vänligen notera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mejl med anledning av GDPR.*

title: Senior Learning & Development Specialist
description:
*Are you passionate about shaping strategic capability development in a high-tech organisation?*
 We are looking for a Senior Learning & Development Specialist who can take full responsibility from analysis to execution, and who thrives in a consultative, business-facing role.
   

  

**Your role**
 As part of the Group HR Learning & Development team, you will drive strategic learning and capability initiatives across Saab’s critical technology areas. You will work closely with Group Strategy, Group Digitialisation, business leaders and competence owners to ensure our learning efforts directly support Saab’s long-term business goals.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Act as a strategic partner to senior stakeholders and competence owners, identifying capability needs in critical competence areas
* Turn insights into learning plans that, support business transformation goals
* Lead end-to-end capability and learning initiatives, securing alignment and ownership across stakeholders.
* Collaborate with internal and external partners to deliver scalable, business-relevant solutions.
* Contribute to the evolution of Saab’s digital learning ecosystem
* Use data and insights to follow up and continuously improve learning outcomes.


 You will be part of a Global L&D team responsible for Saab’s learning strategy, governance and company-wide guidelines. We work closely with key stakeholders, competence owners and L&D Leads in Business Areas and Operational Countries to ensure learning enables Saab’s long-term capabilities.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You are a strategic and pragmatic L&D professional who builds strong partnerships, navigates complex environments and drives initiatives from analysis to implementation. You work confidently with senior stakeholders and enjoy operating in a technical context.
   

  

**To be successful in this role, we believe you have**
* Experience in strategic L&D business partnering or performance consulting.
* Ability to conduct capability or skills analyses and translate insights into clear recommendations.
* Proven experience leading end-to-end learning or capability initiatives in large or complex organisations.
* Experience collaborating with technical, engineering or competence-owning functions.
* Knowledge of learning ecosystems (LMS/LXP, analytics, content ecosystems) at a strategic or architectural level.
* Ability to use data and insights to guide decisions and measure impact.
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English.


**It’s also considered meritorious if you have**
* Experience from technology-intensive or engineering-driven organisations.
* Experience with capability frameworks, skills taxonomies or strategic workforce planning.
* Experience managing L&D vendors or external suppliers.
* Experience facilitating cross-functional capability or governance forums.
* Experience from Industry and Academia collaboration


**Location** 
 : The position may be located in Stockholm, Linköping, Gothenburg or Malmö.
   

  

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement. You can send us your application in either Swedish or English.
   

  

**What You Will Be a Part Of**
 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here.

title: Konsultchef inom försvars- och teknikkonsultverksamhet
description:
**Drivs du av ledarskap, att utveckla andra människor och att kombinera konsultverksamhet, affärsutveckling och teknik inom försvarssektorn? Knowit Defence Technology söker nu en konsultchef som vill ta ansvar för människor, uppdrag och bolagets fortsatta utveckling.**
**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har ett tydligt och inkluderande ledarskap, och som trivs i rollen som linjechef med personalansvar. Du har erfarenhet av att leda och utveckla team samt av rekrytering inom teknisk eller konsultnära verksamhet.
   

  

 Du arbetar med ett coachande förhållningssätt och motiveras av att utveckla både människor och verksamhet.
