title: Powertrain Test Engineer – Wave Energy
description:
Working at CorPower Ocean you will be part of a world class team, determined to make big impact. We are on a mission to bring reliable and competitive wave energy to the world. We offer a high degree of autonomy, combined with great personal responsibility. CorPower Ocean is a global leader in wave energy, with a technology that has shown game-changing performance. Join us in transforming ocean energy into a reliable, renewable power source—and help shape the future of sustainable technology.

 **Role Description**


You will support the design, assembly and operation of our Powertrain test rig to test and validate the components of our future powertrains (generator, inverter, gearbox, battery, etc.). As a member of the Assembly and Test (A&T) team, your work includes collaborating with our Powertrain engineering team to develop test rigs and test plans, conduct tests, analyse data, and troubleshoot hardware and software issues. This position requires hands-on with our equipment hardware and structured verification process to ensure the EES integrates safely and reliably, maintains grid stability, and fulfills obligations under the relevant Grid Code.  

  

**Responsibilities (and Duties)**

* A&T team member responsible for the Powertrain test rig, contributing to the design and leading the assembly, test and operation of the Powertrain test rig.
* Carry out the verification of the specifications of the functional + software requirements, covering all the test rig functions
* Carry out the grid connected EES verification (net consumer)
* Carry out the grid compliance verification (generation connection)
* Develop test automation and maintain monitoring of test rig
* Maintain functional testing resources under operational conditions.
* Clearly communicate issues, successes, and challenges through regular activity reports.
* Use your electronic & mechanical skills and experience to design and participate in test benches
* Support test data analysis and reduction to assess performance and function, identify anomalies, and asssting with data needed to validate analytical or finite element models
* Prepare test plans, reports, and technical documentation, clearly summarizing methods, results, and conclusions.
* Collaborate with design, analysis, and manufacturing teams to resolve structural issues and support design improveme

 **Qualifications and skills**


A power electronic background with proved experience on inverters, generators, battery management systems (software experience a plus)


Languages: Proficient in English verbally and in writing


+ 5years proven as test engineer for test rig with inverters, generators and battery management


+ 3years proven experience of EES and grid compliance verification


Ability to analyze complex data and identify root causes of problems.


Strong Communication skills, both orally and in writing, and enjoy working in a business-related role with several contact points


You can work independently, be proactive and thrive in a fast-growing company.

**As a person:**

* + You are striving for excellence, put quality into everything you do
* + You are self-motivated and constantly seek the most efficient ways to work
* + You always search for simple and elegant solutions to difficult problems
* + You love to learn new things, and take pride in constantly developing your skills
* + You are persistent, knowing it takes stamina to reach pioneering goals
* + You see your tasks through to completion
* + You are comfortable in presenting your solutions internally and externally
* + You are data driven and strive to always back your points with solid analysis

  

CorPower Ocean has a highly diversified team with many nationalities and backgrounds, all working towards the same goal of Powering the Planet by ocean waves.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
We’re looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead several software development teams and take ownership of delivery for an area of the product within Lumera Core. You’ll be accountable for the people, performance, and outcomes across these teams.


This is a hands-on leadership role where you’ll work closely with your teams — helping software and test engineers grow, fostering collaboration, and creating the conditions for sustainable, predictable delivery


You’ll also partner with fellow Engineering Managers and Product Owners to shape priorities, align roadmaps, and build a shared sense of purpose across your area, while contributing to engineering strategy and driving change initiatives within our evolving organization.

**What You’ll Do**


As an Engineering Manager, you’ll build and nurture high-performing teams, coaching and supporting members to develop technical and professional skills. You’ll strengthen delivery practices and ensure performance strikes the right balance between speed, quality, and long-term sustainability.


You’ll own team composition, recruitment, and performance management — including salary and compensation reviews. You’ll champion collaboration, align engineering and product goals, and represent your area in cross-functional leadership forums.


Above all, you’ll keep your teams engaged, motivated, and focused on what matters most.

**Who You Are**

***Leadership & Mindset***

* A people-first leader who finds energy in helping others grow and succeed
* Skilled at empowering individuals and teams through coaching and feedback, with a commitment to building inclusive, high-performing teams.
* Strong in delivery management — ensuring predictable outcomes while balancing short-term priorities with long-term growth.
* A clear and empathetic communicator who builds trust and alignment across teams and stakeholders.
* Confident in modern engineering practices and able to guide teams through technical and organizational change.

***Experience & Qualifications***

* Experience managing software engineering teams.
* At least 3 years of managerial experience with personnel responsibilities, in a development or product-focused environment.
* Holding a 3-year academic degree or equivalent relevant education.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.
* Previous experience from working as a software engineer is a plus.

**Ready for your next step?**  

Apply with your CV or LinkedIn profile. The start date for the position will be agreed upon. A background check will be conducted before a hiring decision is made. If you have any questions, please reach out to felix.wallin@lumera.com.  

  

**Please note that the recruitment process with interviews will begin in mid January 2026.**

**About Lumera**
  

Lumera is dedicated to the digital transformation of the European Life and Pensions industry. As insurtech innovators, we provide future-proof core technology for policy administration.
  

  

The Prudent Revolution is our mission – bridging technology and partnership to navigate the fastest, safest path through complex change for L&P providers.
  

  

We combine tech and industry expertise with relevant market experience to offer a broad range of consultancy and data services – from managing faultless legacy system migration to facilitating compelling end-user experiences.
  

  

Based in Stockholm, Lumera has significant presence with offices in the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Norway, Sweden, India and Vietnam.  

  

Lumera is majority owned by Monterro, a leading Nordic software investor.
  

  

www.lumera.com
  

  

Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook.

title: Senior C# Developer
description:
For over 30 years, Wisentic has helped insurers work smarter through automation and innovation. Today, we’re one of the most trusted insurtech companies in the Nordics, using our SaaS products to simplify complexity, accelerate efficiency, and help insurers achieve their goals faster. Our teams are small, empowered, and focused on delivering real value to our customers - not just shipping features.
   

  

 Being a C# Developer at Wisentic
   

  

 We are growing and looking for Backend heavy Fullstack Developers to help shape the future of Inspira, one of Wisentics core platforms. A system that helps insurance companies, and their customers, manage administrative processes within claims handling and health declarations. You will be instrumental in driving the technical development, making key design decisions, and helping in reducing legacy while building a sustainable, future-proof SaaS product.
   

  

 Working in a small and focused development team, you help create solutions that make a real difference for both current and future users. Your work includes designing, developing, and maintaining backend systems built on .NET 10, while collaborating closely with other developers to make informed technical decisions and drive modernization efforts. Along the way, you help reduce technical debt and build a scalable, maintainable architecture that supports long-term growth.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we think that you:**
* Have extensive experience in .NET/C# backend development, preferably within SaaS and microservices environments.
* Are a developer who approaches problems with a product mindset, balancing technical decisions with user value and long-term product goals.
* Are comfortable working across the full stack and open to engaging with frontend technologies like Angular.
* Possess experience with cloud platforms, with a preference for Azure.
* Can independently break down complex user stories and lead technical initiatives.
* Are curious, eager to learn, and stays updated on modern technology trends.
* Are fluent in English (Swedish is a big plus).


 Why join us?
   

  

 We are a mission-driven company where your ideas have real impact. You’ll be part of a small, empowered product team - not a feature factory. Work closely with talented peers who value trust, autonomy, and craftsmanship, all in a hybrid setup at the heart of Stockholm. We start our Fridays with a proper breakfast buffet and add a few rounds of Mario Kart whenever there is room for a little extra fun. Excited by what you’ve read? We’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Due to the Christmas holiday season, we will start reviewing applications again from January 7.

title: Software Engineer with interest in AI/LLMs
description:
*Rillion is looking for a Software Engineer who will develop AI-powered features within Accounts Payable (AP) automation and improve our existing SaaS platform. We work across the full product lifecycle, from design to implementation and deployment, unlocking the potential of AI in AP automation.* 




  





**About the role** 




 You’ll become part of the Capture team that is creating Rillion’s own AI-powered service for automated invoice handling. The challenge is to take invoices in countless formats and turn them into structured data – forming the foundation for automation across the entire Rillion platform.
 



 You will be part of the full journey: designing, building and running reliable cloud-based services in production, while also contributing to discovery and product discussions. This is a hands-on development role where you combine strong software engineering with AI in a modern SaaS environment.
 



  





**Who we're looking for** 




 We believe you are a skilled developer with experience in building and operating cloud services. You are curious, collaborative and interested in how products are built and improved.
 



  





**We think you have:** 



* Several years of experience as a software engineer
* Experience in building and operating cloud-based services in a DevOps environment
* Genuine interest in AI and motivation to grow your skills in applying it to real-world challenges
* Master’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent



  





**It’s a plus if you have:** 



* Exposure to AI/LLM projects
* Excellent skills in Python



  





**Why Rillion?** 




 Rillion is a fast-growing SaaS company with a strong focus on using AI to help customers automate their workflows. At Rillion, engineers are closely involved in product direction and innovation. You’ll get the opportunity to work with both cloud and AI in a real production environment and be part of building a new core capability in the product.
 



 We also offer:
 


* A hybrid work model – work from our central Stockholm office twice a week
* A generous wellness allowance and benefits package
* Regular social events, hackathons and knowledge-sharing sessions
* An open, collaborative culture where your ideas are valued and your work makes a real impact for customers across the globe



  





 We´re excited to start meeting potential new colleagues. If that's you, don't hesitate to apply!

title: Software Engineer - Optimization & Algorithms
description:
At TRATON Group, we believe that the whole can be greater than the sum of its parts. Together with our brands we can make the future of transportation more sustainable - Let´s make a difference together.
   

  

 The TRATON AB office, located in Södertälje, consists of experienced colleagues with various backgrounds and nationalities from all TRATON Group brands. We enjoy solving strategic problems cross functional and cross brand in the TRATON Group. We strive for a climate where opinions and knowledge are openly shared within and between teams and we welcome new ideas in order to create dynamic synergies.
   

  

 With its brands Scania, MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus and International, TRATON Group is one of the world’s leading commercial vehicle manufacturers. Its offering comprises light-duty commercial vehicles, trucks, and buses. At TRATON, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation. Find out more: www.traton.com
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We develop software that is central to how transport companies plan and operate electrified heavy-duty truck fleets. Our systems are designed to be used daily as part of our customers’ core transport operations, and directly influence how planning and execution decisions are made.
   

  

 Our mission is to create the shift to a sustainable transport system through better planning and use of transportation resources. The tools we build are key enablers of that shift.
   

  

 At the core of the system is optimization logic related to well-studied but computationally hard problem classes such as electric vehicle routing, resource-constrained routing, and large-scale re-planning. These problems are addressed using a combination of algorithmic techniques, heuristics, decomposition methods, and domain-specific knowledge.
   

  

 Solutions often start as small scripts or prototypes and are evolved into production-grade cloud services. The product is already running, with customer release planned for 2026.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Design and implement optimization algorithms for single-vehicle routing and re-planning
* Contribute to fleet-level optimization in performance-critical components
* Work with problems where data structures, algorithmic complexity, and performance are central
* Combine vehicle models, charging infrastructure constraints, and geospatial data into solvable formulations
* Build and operate backend services deployed to the cloud and improve their production behaviour
* Influence algorithm design, architecture, and system behaviour in production


**Who You Are**
 You are a software engineer with a solid background in computer science.
   

  

 You are comfortable with:
   

  

  

* Algorithms and data structures
* Reasoning about complexity and engineering trade-offs
* Translating theoretical ideas into code
* Experience with optimization, algorithm competitions, competitive programming, or similar backgrounds is highly relevant. Equally important is the ability to work constructively with others and contribute to shared technical decisions.


 This role is a good fit if you:
   

  

  

* Want to work deeply with algorithmically hard problems in real systems
* Care about performance, correctness, and long-term maintainability
* Want real influence over technical direction and solutions
* Value working with skilled, considerate colleagues


**This Is Us**
 The team has full ownership of technical decisions and direction, including algorithmic approaches, system architecture, and technology stack. The stack is chosen by the team and evolves as the product matures.
   

  

 Our problem domain is informed by ongoing research. We collaborate closely with academic partners and use scientific literature as input to practical engineering decisions. You are not expected to know everything on day one, but you are expected to engage deeply and learn continuously.
   

  

**TRATON AB Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. The group also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-01-31. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Viktor Leek, recruiting manager, at viktor.leek@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON AB

title: Testledare till försvarskund
description:
**Bygga framtidens lösningar inom offentlig sektor och försvar tillsammans med oss på Nexer Public Sales!**
 Har du flera års erfarenhet av att leda testarbete och en nyfikenhet på hur testmetodik kan utvecklas och förbättras? Då kan du vara den testledare vi söker.
   

  

 Som konsult hos Nexer får du en trygg och långsiktig anställning, samtidigt som du får möjlighet att utvecklas i uppdrag som gör skillnad. Vi tror på hållbar kompetensutveckling, balans i livet och att du ska få växa både tekniskt och som person.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som testledare ansvarar du för att planera, koordinera och följa upp testarbetet hos våra kunder. Du skriver testplaner, bemannar testuppdrag, prioriterar aktiviteter och driver förbättringar i testprocessen. Du leder arbetet inom områden som acceptanstestning, end-to-end-testning och API-testning, och har god förståelse för hur olika testverktyg och metoder används effektivt. Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteam, produktägare och kravanalytiker och bidrar med struktur, kvalitet och tydlighet i varje steg.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet av både manuella och automatiserade tester. Du har lett testprojekt av varierande storlek och arbetat med teststrategi, testrapportering, testdokumentation och testplanering. Du har god kännedom om testverktyg och är van att arbeta i agila miljöer. Du har en förståelse för hur testarbete integreras i det agila flödet och hur du bäst samverkar med andra roller i teamet. Det är meriterande om du är ISTQB-certifierad.
   

  

 För rollen krävs svenskt medborgarskap samt mycket god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska, både muntligt och skriftligt. Uppdraget är förlagt hos kund i Enköping och innebär fysisk närvaro på plats fem dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Om Public Sales**
 Public Sales är Nexers affärsområde för offentlig sektor. Vi arbetar med samhällsviktiga uppdrag för myndigheter, regioner och kommuner, och nu stärker vi vår närvaro i Mälardalsregionen. Hos oss får du inte bara bidra till viktiga lösningar, du får också vara med och forma kulturen och bygga upp något tillsammans med oss.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan via formuläret nedan. Vi hanterar inte ansökningar via e-post enligt GDPR, men har du frågor om tjänsten eller Nexer är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare: Xie Gamboa, xie.gamboa@nexergroup.com.
   

  

 Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande, så vänta inte med att söka!
   

  

 Läs mer om Nexer på www.nexergroup.com

title: Backendutvecklare till samhällsbärande e-handel på Kronans Apotek
description:
*Välkommen till vår värld! 👑 Vår vision är en värld som mår bra, och du kan hjälpa oss att göra den visionen verklig. Vi tror att meningsfulla arbetsuppgifter, starka teamrelationer och en generös dos skratt skapar en arbetsmiljö som inspirerar och stärker oss och alla våra kunder. Med fokus på både här och nu, samt på framtiden - bidrar vi tillsammans till en värld som mår bra! 🌍🧡🚀*
 Vill du arbeta med samhällskritiska system, komplex affärslogik och nära affären – där dina tekniska beslut faktiskt spelar roll?
   

  

 På Kronans Apotek bygger och utvecklar vi hela vår e-handel själva. Vi ser till att kunden hittar till oss, kan handla egenvård och hämta ut recept, och att paketen kommer hem. En central del i allt detta är vår integration mot eHälsomyndigheten, vilken möjliggör digital recepthantering. Nu tar vi hem ansvaret för denna integration in-house för att stärka kontroll, kvalitet, och långsiktigt ägarskap.
 **Därför söker vi två backendutvecklare till vårt team.**
**Om rollen**
 Du kommer arbeta med vår affärskritiska integration mot eHälsomyndigheten. Det är ett tekniskt modernt system, men den stora utmaningen ligger inte i ramverk eller kodproduktion, utan i att:
   

  

  

* Tolka komplexa regelverk
* Göra tekniska och affärsmässiga avvägningar
* Bygga robusta lösningar i en reglerad miljö


 Du jobbar dagligen tillsammans med produktägare (farmaceut) och nära andra delar av verksamheten, och förväntas ta ansvar hela vägen från krav till REST-anrop. Rollen passar både dig som är senior och vill ta stort tekniskt ansvar, och dig som är mid-level och vill växa i en komplex domän med stöd av erfarna kollegor.
   

  

**Exempel på vad du gör**
* Förvaltar och vidareutvecklar en .NET-baserad nybyggd integrationslösning
* Implementerar komplex affärslogik kring recept, högkostnadsskydd och fullmakter
* Tar tekniska och arkitektoniska beslut tillsammans med teamet
* Samarbetar med säkerhet, juridik, compliance och driftpartner
* Bygger lösningar med höga krav på säkerhet, loggning och spårbarhet


 Utöver arbetet med själva integrationen finns det goda möjligheter att, utifrån intresse och erfarenhet, engagera sig i avdelningsövergripande områden som till exempel:
   

  

  

* Säkerhet
* Devops-samarbetet med driftpartner
* Observability, loggning och spårbarhet
* Teknisk strategi och framtida vägval
* Dokumentation av komplex domän- och integrationslogik


 Vi uppmuntrar utvecklare att ta ägarskap och bidra där de har intresse, och rollen kan till viss del formas efter dina styrkor.
   

  

**Teknikmiljö (i korthet)**
* .NET 8 / ASP.NET Core
* PostgreSQL, Redis
* Docker, Kubernetes
* Observability via Datadog


 Integrationen är av historiska skäl byggd i .NET medan vår övriga backend är Java. Vi ser det inte som akut att migrera (lösningen är nybyggd och fungerar väl) men långsiktigt vill vi minska teknisk mångfald. Vi söker någon som prioriterar affärslösningen och långsiktigt värde över språklojalitet.
   

  

**Om teamet och vardagen**
 Du blir en del av ett tvärfunktionellt utvecklingsteam på 14 personer bestående av backendutvecklare, frontendutvecklare och UX-designer. Teamet tillhör e-handelsorganisationen och ansvarar gemensamt för utvecklingen av hela Kronans Apoteks e-handel. Du rapporterar till utvecklingschef.
   

  

 Vi arbetar Kanban-liknande med fokus på flyt, kvalitet och gemensamt ansvar. Vardagen präglas av mycket självständigt arbete kombinerat med par- och mobprogrammering. Teamet har daglig synk för att hantera blockers och säkerställa framdrift, samt regelbundna 1:1:or med utvecklingschef.
   

  

 Kulturen i teamet är trygg, hjälpsam och ansvarstagande. De mer seniora utvecklarna delar gärna med sig av sin kunskap, och de mer juniora är nyfikna och engagerade. Tekniska beslut fattas av teamet tillsammans, medan utvecklingschefen fokuserar på affär, process och personal – med ett coachande och nära ledarskap.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter samarbete högt och undviker medvetet prestige, silos och individuella stjärnspelare. Kontorsdagarna används till samarbete, workshops och det sociala – för oss är hybridarbetet ett sätt att kombinera fokus med gemenskap, inte ett kontrollverktyg.
   

  

**Praktiskt**
* Placering: Stockholm (Kungsholmen)
* Arbetssätt: Hybrid (2–3 dagar på kontoret)
* Bakgrundskontroll tillämpas för slutkandidater
* För den seniora rollen är lönespannet 60 000-65 000 och för mid-level 45 000-50 000


 Vi söker både en senior och en mid-level utvecklare. För oss är det viktigare hur du angriper problem än exakt vilka språk du jobbat i. Vi tror att du:
   

  

  

* Har erfarenhet av komplex affärslogik och integrationsutveckling
* Är bekväm med att arbeta i ett komplext men stundvis inkomplett kravlandskap
* Vågar ta beslut och stå för dem
* Trivs med ansvar och autonomi
* Har mycket god svenska i tal och skrift


 Meriterande:
   

  

  

* Erfarenhet av reglerade miljöer (myndighet, vård, finans)
* Säkerhet, loggning, persondata
* Kubernetes/Docker (förståelse, ej driftansvar)


**Varför Kronans Apotek?**
* Du jobbar med system som påverkar människors vardag på riktigt
* Du får stort förtroende och verkligt inflytande
* Du arbetar väldigt nära affären
* Moderna teknikplattformar och verktyg, med stor möjlighet att förändra
* Trevliga, kompetenta kollegor
* Ordentligt friskvårdsbidrag och högt fokus på välmående


**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
 Vad roligt att du är intresserad av att söka rollen hos oss! Vi vet att det kan kännas utmanande att söka jobb, särskilt i tider när konkurrensen är hög och många skickar in ansökningar. Men i verkligheten kan vi oftast bara välkomna en ny kollega per roll, vilket tyvärr innebär att flera starka kandidater inte går vidare – även om de har mycket att erbjuda.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt att du ska känna dig trygg med hur processen går till. Vi vill därför vara öppna med hur vi gör vårt urval. Vi gör alltid en helhetsbedömning av ansökan. Självklart tittar vi på CV och erfarenheter, men det är inte det enda som spelar in. När vi rekryterar utgår vi från en tydlig kravprofil som vi delar i annonsen. Dina svar på urvalsfrågorna – och ibland även testresultat – vägs också in i vår bedömning. Vid många ansökningar kan just de delarna bli avgörande, så ta gärna lite extra tid att fylla i urvalsfrågorna noggrant innan du skickar in.
   

  

 Utöver detta tittar vi även på hur erfarenheter och kompetenser matchar det behov och sammanhang vi har i teamet just nu. På så sätt vill vi ge varje kandidat en så rättvis och transparent process som möjligt.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 I din ansökan vill vi ha ditt CV eller din LinkedInprofil. Personligt brev? Det kan du skippa! Vi är intresserade av din kompetens, lära känna dig gör vi vid en eventuell intervju. I slutet av rekryteringsprocessen tillämpar vi en bakgrundskontroll på samtliga personer vi vill anställa, oavsett roll eller funktion. Då vi enbart tillämpar detta på slutkandidat informerar vi mer om det längre fram.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

***Vi bryr oss mer***
*- och det är även något vi delar med våra fackliga parter och tillsammans arbetar vi för en värld som mår bra. För att komma i kontakt med våra fackliga representanter kan du maila Gunilla Andersson på Unionen via gunilla.andersson@kronansapotek.se, Verdi Sawma på Unionen via verdi.sawma@kronansapotek.se eller Aisha Karimi på Sveriges Farmaceuter via af.kronan@sverigesfarmaceuter.se. Vill du fördjupa dig i vårt kollektivavtal? Du hittar hela avtalet här!*

title: Robot Painting Programmer / Paint Application Specialist
description:
**About The Assignment**
 We are looking for an
 **experienced robot programmer** 
 with strong expertise in
 **robot painting / paint application** 
 . The assignment focuses on programming and optimizing industrial robots used in painting and coating processes, where precision, quality, and repeatability are critical.
   

  

 You will work in a technically advanced production environment together with automation, process, and production teams.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Programming industrial robots for painting and coating applications
* Working with Paint applications (spray logic, motion paths, process parameters)
* Optimizing paint quality, cycle times, and process stability
* Troubleshooting and fine-tuning robots in production environments
* Close collaboration with automation, process, and production teams


**Required Qualifications**
* Proven experience in robot programming within paint / coating / spray applications
* Hands-on experience with Paint applications for industrial robots
* Solid understanding of industrial painting processes
* Ability to work independently in complex technical environments


 Meriting experience
   

  

* Background from automotive or manufacturing industries
* Experience with commissioning and production ramp-up
* General knowledge of industrial automation and robotics


 Personal qualities
   

  

* Hands-on, solution-oriented mindset
* High attention to detail and quality
* Strong communication and collaboration skills


 Interested? Apply today!
